idea:
-a gondola system like at a ski resort

-it will be high speed and high capacity, holding up to 10 people per cart

-there will be "Stations" going from each major neighborhood center going towards major popular destinations like malls, restaurants, etc.
A activator people carry around and activate when they need a pickup. A wait time is calculated and shown to them. Something you carry on a key chain and just push a button.
A automated truck that delivers groceries and people when bad weather happens and trees are down on the road. Its a big truck that can get through everything
A bicycle helmet with speakers and Bluetooth connectivity for your phone.

A bicycle rental system that allows town-owned bicycles to be "checked out" at various locations throughout the city, and returned to any of several locations. This will encourage people to ride bikes, even if they do not own them themselves.
A bicycle rickshaw service.
A bicycle service for when you are not in a hurry.
A bicycle taxi service
A bicycle that can lock itself when the owner forgets to lock it.
A bicycle that is completely powered using solar batteries. Therefore, it needs neither peddling nor gasoline for it to keep going.
A bicycle with spheres instead of wheels
A bicycle-only highway.

A big massive trailer with comfortable seats, and a breakfast bar that you can sign up for so it comes to your house, or a predetermined bus stop at a certain time.  Everything is reserved so you must opt in.  On the bus there is simple things, such as bagels/croissants/danish etc.  It's a good way to grab a quick bite to eat before work, and wake yourself up with some coffee.  The bus will use an algorithm to determine people to put on the bus that are on the way to the same destination, or a similar destination, while not going too far out of the way to pick them up.

A bike path that has a divider between the road and the bike path. A dedicated bike path that has a sense of security could encourage more people to bike around town since they wouldn't need to share the road with cars.
A bike path that is in place of all the roads. No cars will be allowed. There will be no worrying about being hit by a car when riding your bike.
A bike rental service that lest customers rent bikes for reasonable rates daily or weekly, with pick up and return spots very conveniently located around the city
A bike with jet packs
A board that can actually hover above the ground, perhaps I'm thinking of a jet pack. But it would be something that would allow the rider to maneuver around slightly above the ground.
A both walking and bike lane that provides safety from traffic, is well lit, and connects key locations around the neighborhood.
A bunch of self driving cars that will replace buses and taxis. The will have free wifi and be very cheap.

A bus system similar to a paternoster, but horizontal instead of vertical. This would be a system of interconnected cars with seats that would follow along a set track in a loop, and always be running, so people would just walk on and walk off the system when they reached their stop - no stopping and starting.
a bus system that lets you rack up points for rewards

A Bus system, within the metro area that was funded by a tax on gas purchased by individual commuters. In otherwords, free to the people who use the bus, and costs the people who don't. have the busses rinning from a set time like 6am to 9 pm  and pickups are every 15 min, so you never need to bother with knowing the bus schedule. Also, have all busses make a stop in the center of town so if you need to get across town, take a bus from you house to the center, and from there to your final destination. There should be a bus passing every school, hospital, shopping center, library ect. Simply run smaller buses on less popular routes, use smaller buses in general. make one special route for city to city transfers. The system needs to be free or very affordable, fast and convenient. No need to waste resources and infrastructure on schedules, call centers, web pages, just keep it simple and convenient.

A bus that has a design similar to a hydrofoil boat. The bus would run on special tracks that would be parallel to each other on opposite sides of a street. This passenger compartment would be on top, with the "foils" connecting to the two tracks. There would be open space underneath the passenger compartment where the road is. This way, the bus could move unimpeded by traffic, while also not disrupting traffic itself. Also, passengers would not even see the traffic below them, making the ride smooth, comfortable, and consistent.
a bus that has little cars in it to take people different places, and once it lets them out the car returns to the bus for others

A bus that is programed to do the fastest route possible for what people need. There is a station where they push their destination, and a program figurs out who needs to go where and the best way to do it. Reduces wait time and makes more people want to use it.
A bus with 8 off road tires and a strong engine that could easily get the passengers through even the snowiest of days. We can call it the Wolverine.
A bus with live performers
A cab system which optimizes fares by calculating the best way to get multiple people to their destination. It's like a bus but it doesn't follow a route.
A car pool van that does loops around our town picking up kids and dropping them off at various activities. There can be an app that works to hail the van and parents can track where its going

A car pooling app. Non-drivers and those looking for regular rides who normally carpool would join the community and hook up with drivers who are going to their general destination. There would be a monthly fee, which would lowered and even be removed if someone drives/uses their car enough. For example, it's $5 per month, and every time YOU drive it goes down by .50 cents. There's incentive for both non-drivers (a small fee for rides) and drivers (free membership, maybe some gas reimbursement).
A car that scans particular people before allowing it to run to prevent thieves.

A car that woeks with the magnetic forces of earth, applying a system that can take advantage of all the force that can be generated. It can also work with other alternative energies such as solar power or wind power. All of these energies mixed in one idea and also fossil fuels but to a minimum scale.
A cargo bike rental that came with discounts at supermarkets and hardware stores.
A carpool app. It has profiles of possible matches and helps match up route schedules.

A central hub for a ridesharing service that provides cars for small groups to take to neighboring towns. I live in a rural area, a few minutes from a very small village. The nearest SMALL city is about 30 minutes away, and the nearest decent sized city is almost an hour away. A ridesharing service would make accessing these places much easier, and if the company provided the car (for a fee, of course), those without vehicles could be serviced.
A chair lift system to get from point a to point b, with multiple stops along the way if you need it.
a chute system with high travel.
A circular bicycle that everyone pedals together.

A circulatory bus system consisting of two vehicle traveling in opposite directions on a set route but with no designated stops. The route in my small district of the city takes approximately 20 minutes to to circumnavigate and consists of goth commercial districts. One would never be more than 10 minutes fro being able to hail the "jitney" bus. This alleviates the use of regular bus system which is much more focused on funneling clientele to central city and runs more or less eradicately.It envisions using current tech and is human centered. It is innovative in it's goals not hardware.
A city bus that has entertainment in it like movies and music

A civilian shuttle service that is cheaper when compared to Uber or Lyft that has a specific destination (i.e. the airport or certain resort stops). It would hold around 40 passengers and you'd have to call it in advance as if scheduling an appointment. Anyone can use it and seniors and disabled would receive discounts.
A community carpool.

A community system that is managed electronically and requests cars any time of day. All cars are electric and will take you anywhere you want to go for a set charge and there are maintenance teams that come and clean cars during the day.
A company that picks you up in a car of your choice.

A concept similar to Uber, but with a bus. Especially in a city the socialization factor of riding with other passengers while going to a destination could be nice. You would be able to specifically request stops and pickups.
A conveyor belt system like the airport set up like the nyc trains would be awesome.  A bit slow going, but cheap, affordable, and it would allow people to be out in the fresh air again.
A covered moving sidewalk that allows you to walk on it as well so you get to where you need but also get exercise. It would run throughout the city.

A crowd-sourced bus stop app. Instead of having fixed bus stops throughout the city. People through a smart phone app request a bus to stop at a certain locations. This would provide information to the bus service company in improving the locations and times of where service is needed the most.

A crowdfunding site that tries to solve mini societal problems. It's like a non-government organization but this tries to solve mini problems such as buying a net for a local basketball court or a reforestation project.
A device that monitors all your vital signs (pulse, blood pressure, body temp, etc) and is connected to a smart phone app that lets you easily share the info with your doctor.
A disaster movie about a blimp that gets a slow leak.  Most of the movie will take place in the cockpit.  It will be conversational based between the pilots and air traffic control.

A driverless mini-coach will be the norm. Summoned through an "uber" type app, the responding vehicle will be selected based on pickup and destination points. All riders will be photoed and violators cited.
A drone system where small helicopters would come down and pick up people. It would work like a bus in that it takes people to drone stops.
A drone taxi that picks you up and drops you off at your desired location.
A electric scooter sharing program for getting around town without having to drive a car and use too much gas or take up too much space.
a fan that goes on top of your outdoor HVAC unit. The exhaust from the HVAC turns the fan, which then generates electricity.

A fare based system would allow heavy car users to pay more and light ones to pay less for gas, tolls, etc.  Their car will have a gps tracker to see where and when they go (downtown, rush hour, etc.)  This will help the people who don't need to drive as much and tax the ones that are always on the road.

A fleet of automated cars that have pre-programmed destinations in them. You use your credit or debit card to pay. Swipe it and then pick your destination and it takes you there, charging you based on how far away it is and not based on time so it's better than a cab, and also uses the new robotic cars.

A fleet of cheap, reliable, automated taxi cars. The cars would drive automatically after an input was made for the destination. These cars would be self charging with paint that has solar energy potential.
a fleet of pedicabs
A fleet of smart, autonomous busses.
A flexible public transport system that shuttles students from my neighborhood to the school
A flying bike that can come straight to you with a click of a button from your phone or tablet.
a flying car to dodge traffic
A flying car would be a good innovation. We would free up the roads making less traffic jams and it'd give people new experiences.
A form of alternative transportation would be in the form of an SUV crossed with a 4wheeler. However, it would need to be affordable and able to be driven on main roads.

A form of transportation similar to an airlift, only the seats are at terminals on the ground. You board and they take you to predesignated stops in a direct line, free of traffic. Like a shuttle or train, only on a smaller scale, and ideally seats come in much more frequently, every 30 seconds or so.

A free taxi service for students, especially for nights so that students can get back safely. Instead of a car or a big bus, it could be a small bus so that it can fit enough people, but not use too much gas.
a fun car that always tells jokes to the passengers
A futuristic railway that could stop at different stops depending on if people are their or now, it could run on renewable energy and stop every quarter mile.
A giant water slide that takes you from tower to tower in a city

A going to town app. In a rural area like where I live sometimes you avoid going to town because you don't have a ride or you just don't feel you can justify driving all that way just to run a quick errand. Enter an app that connects you to people along your travel rout who also need to go into town. You could flag yourself as offering a ride or needing a ride.
A golf cart-like train that circles the small town I live in on a regular basis.

A great mode of transportation in my neighborhood could be a bus or tram that runs along the local parkway (a road that basically goes across the whole town) people would be able to hop on it and ride it to their destination and be there within walking distance when getting off the bus/tram. Could be relatively cheap, clear up traffic with less people having to drive around, and is highly economical.

A group carpooling smartphone app that allows people in apartment complexes or housing areas to visualize a profile of others in the area that are traveling to a nearby destination. Participants can communicate over the app, and background check and everything is done before being certified to use the service. People can post looking for ride notes, or say that they are traveling to a specific area and looking for passengers to ride in order to split costs.
A high speed conveyor belt that travels through peoples' houses that can take people to city centers.

A high speed monorail system that winds its way through all the important points of interest in the city. It would look futuristic and high tech with a sophisticated level of design along with being reliable.
A high speed train/subway that links all the cities in the Detroit metro area.
A high-speed rail that goes around the neighborhood into the city.

A hitchhiking app where everyone has a profile with "reviews" from other drivers and hitchhikers. If you're walking somewhere you can turn on the app and if someone else with the app happens to drive by they can pick you up.
A horse drawn carriage would be nice
A hover board sharing service. Like a car rental but with hover boards. Must be located near bike paths.
A hoverboard lane just like bikers!
A hoverboard that is powered by solar power
A hovering scooter with its own lane on the roads

A human carrying drone. This would require it to be build and withstand certain weight thresholds, such as up to 200 pounds. You would call a drone in and let it know where you want to go. It would pick you up and fly you there at a decent rate of speed and without having to sit in traffic.
A human taxi system like they have in Asian countries. A guy can run around with a cart and pick up passengers.

A human tube system, similar to televison shows like Futurama, and already in use by banks, albeit for parcels and not people. If we installed vacuum tubes that led to a multitude of central destinations, we could develop a toll system alongside it. Using air pressure would cut out emissions immensely, and would be relatively fast, allowing for faster travel times than traditional modes of transportation. However, the difficulty would come from utilizing the system in such a way that remained safe for all those involved, perhaps through making use of a stop and go turbine system, that worked similarly to a stop light. A smart air restriction system would allow for one way travel, and then a short delay, followed by travel in the other direction.

A human-sized slot-car system.  Where cars run independently self-driving down a track through electricity like a trolley car, but just big enough for a regular sized family (in other words size of a regular car).  In order to move faster cars can link up by matching speed and then essentially "plugging" into the car ahead of it.  This could go much faster than regular cars and not have any of the problems associated with regular self-drive cars seeing as they move on a track.
a hyper tube that transports people though air
A imagine a system like Ã¼ber but with driverless technology. And I imagine people renting on car for a group of people to commute.

A jitney that makes local stops within a few miles of a small town.  My town would be perfect as an example.  Most errands can be run in a 10 mile radius.  This includes, post office, shopping centers, DMV, library, etc.  there could be a call in to meet at nearest cross stop.  We have 2 main roads that run through town so this would be very easy to implement.
A large network of rails traveling from downtown to every other part part of the surrounding area featuring energy efficient, sleek that arrive every ten to twenty minutes at each station
a large open vehicle that moves slowly on wheels around the downtown area, carries about 25 people
A larger bike path so that more people could ride their bikes places. Also every few miles they could have a bench for people to rest with a water fountain.
a lazy river in the summer would be a fun way to get around

A light rail from city center to neighboring suburbs that would replace thousands of commuters and make rush hours less crowded and stressful. This could be as simple as one station in each suburb (thus 10-15 total stations), or a more complex system with multiple stations in each suburb.
A light rail that goes around town quickly and efficiently with routes that will help the people who use it most.
A local-government sponsored ridesharing service, much like Uber. However, the proprietors will be the local government, so the commissions from rides will be reinvested into the local community.
A magnetic railway car, like a trolley, that moves and stops by people pressing buttons on the side of the road

A magnetic roadway system, where people move in modular pods that are controlled by a central operating system (COS). Magnets underneath the street guide your pod along, and every movement of all of the pods is controlled perfectly by the computerized system, it is completely autonomous. If your whole family wants to go into town, you assemble your four-pod system and take off, where traffic is optimized perfectly by the COS. If just you are on your way to work, you hop in your single passenger pod, and take off!
A map that has the location of buses currently running so that you can see how long it takes for your bus to reach you while waiting for the bus.

A monorail sort of train, raised over the cityscape and nearly silent as it passes overhead.  There would be platforms raised up several stories high, with elevators to reach street level.  The trains would be sleek and shiny silver or white, gleaming in the sun.  The trains would change smoothly and seamlessly from track to track, so that each one can have a different route.

A monorail system that is above everyone.  There would be rail cars on it that go in a multitude of directions.  People can still use the other forms of transportation, but this form would be strictly for people looking to get around in the city.  They would park their cars before entering the city, and use this quick system for getting around.  No more crowded, expensive parking in the city.
A monorail type transportation system.
A more affordable public transit (or shuttle bus) that is crowdsourced/crowdfunded and takes passengers anywhere within a certain radius (e.g. 30 mile radius, etc.).

A more thorough bus system with buses running more frequently and covering a wider area.  Other modes would not be feasible for this area.



An Uber-type crowd-sourced system for carpooling.

A motorized scooter "stop."  Basically a few very popular areas you can pick up a scooter from an agent.  Credit is the only thing that's acceptable, as they need to have something on file in case you ride off with the scooter.  These locations where you can both rent, and return scooters will only be in very popular areas (Such as the mall, a large amount of business buildings, and the like.)  Make it relatively affordable, and have people be able to write it off as an expense.
A motorized scooter program where  you can rent them from stations throughout the city.

A moving sidewalk - like the ones you would see in an airport to help expedite movement between terminals.  Around my area there are a lot of close shops, so people could walk, but getting loads of bags home would be difficult.  Having mechanical walkways would enable people to do their shopping but reduce their need to use cars, and at the same time set all their bags down so they don't have to figure out how to lug them home, especially if they've purchased something heavy.  It could also allow people to get where they need to go faster, if they continue to walk along the moving sidewalk.  They could sit alongside regular sidewalks, so people who still wanted to go out for a walk and get some fresh air could do so.  The mechanical/moving sidewalks would be made out of metal, look like a flat escalator, have hand railings, and each side of the road would have a sidewalk that goes the same way as traffic.
A moving sidewalk could be useful in some areas of my neighbourhood.
A moving sidewalk outside main street.

A moving sidewalk with seats.  You could get on and off easily.  In the high density corridor, this sidewalk would have seats that you sit on and would move you down the corridor.  Getting a person with a wheelchair four blocks can be a big problem.  You would just roll onto this moving sidewalk and they would be moved.
A much-improved subway.  It is faster and has far fewer delays than the current line.  It is also relatively affordable.
A multiple person bike system that converts all the energy created in a moderate speed. This system has an own lane and its free for users, its an ecological way to get to any given detination.

A mutli-layed monorail system that is solar and wind powered. I leave in las vegas, which has a centralized population. It would go up and down the strip and between the strip and downtown and around the city.

A network of green transportation for rent. You insert coins and it releases a bike, a skateboard, a scooter or some other form of efficient transportation. You drive it to your destination and once you deliver it to the hotpspot you can get your money back, if it is in good condition.

A network of publicly available electric cars will drive around the city in the most efficient manner possible. People will use apps to call a car to get them =from one of many pickup spots and drop them off before they go on the next passenger.

A network of quadcopters (drones) large enough to transport humans. Let's say you need to get to the other side of town quickly, and want to avoid traffic -- get in a drone and have it deliver you by air!

A network of roads that we all on different levels depending on which direction you were going, so that there were never any stops that needed to be made, simply merging onto an onramp/offramp which takes you up or down a level or two and allows you to then merge onto the new direction you are desiring to travel.
A network of self driving cars on demand.  You set your pickup time and location via app, as well as destination and desired arrival time.
A network of self driving cars that are owned by the community. When you need one, you just summon one like Uber.
A new bus route that could go through my town. It would have a different route than the buses we currently have.

A new carpool system. You get together with a group of people at a park and ride. Park your car there and commute in a van with a group of people to work. This save gas and some of you can nap while the other is driving.

A new form of transportation that could be well used in my community would be a large seating vehicle that took people on and off the local military bases. There are 5 bases here and in the morning and evening commute there are traffic issues around those bases. A way to remove at least half the vehicles could cut down on pollution and traffic around the base for people off the base as well as on. This would be a military carpool of sorts to also eliminate parking issues.
A new innovative transportation system would be automated cars. They can pick you up and drop you off wherever you need to be.
A new railway system! We don't have any trains or railways anywhere near the area I live in.

a new system in my neighborhood could be bicycle - but have taxi options, so additional seats attached, perhaps rickshaw style. A person would pedal (no motors, so no issues with being on road) and there would be a seat on the back for a rider. There would be a helmet with each rider.

A new system of transporation in my neighborhood that I would really enjoy is high speed trains that could get you from one part of the city to  another in 5 minutes. The transportation would have ample amount seating for the fast trip and great views of the city. I would want for this train to run above the streets and not over the streets so some kind of over ground railway would have to be created.

A new taxi service that uses mopeds rather than cars. It's something used quite frequently in other countries (such as Brazil). You would be able to call for assistance or simply stop them off the side of the road (just like a taxi, obviously).

A new transportation idea would be to have bikes that can be rented.  I have seen this in some towns such as Austin, Texas.  Where you can find a bank of rental bikes every couple of blocks.  How awesome would it be if this was more normal and people could choose to ride a bike to the store to grab a loaf of bread or something, rather than getting in the car and wasting gas and adding to pollution.

A new transportation method could be using self driving vehicles. During times when you are needing to pre drink before going to a bar to save money, you find yourself unable to drive to the said bar. With self driving vehicles, you can let the robot do the critical thinking for you to ensure your safe arrival to your friendly neighborhood bar. This would be fun and convenient. This would also reduce the amount of wrecks on a friday and saturday night.
A new transportation system  can be something somewhat like a train, but a small train like shuttle, which can take others around the neighborhood, easy, fast and no traffic.

A new transportation system for my neighborhood would be a uber-like bus service. Buses have specific routes, and can stop at any point on that route if you use the service. That way you can have one pick you up close to your house instead of having to drop your car off at a bus station.

A new transportation system for our neighborhood could be shared scooters.  The scooters would be open for all to use and stocked at locations around the neighborhood.  You could check them out and return them for less money than the cost of a scooter.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood could be the use of drones to fly individuals in and around town, or to far off destinations. The drones would fly like helicopters, but can  can also be controlled using a remote control. Unlike a car which can transport several passengers, the drone would be only be able to transport one person.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be a railway system available to rural and outlying areas.  It would stretch along the roadway and connect to different cities and stops much like a trolley system or train system.  People could get on and off at different points.  They could schedule to be picked up at different times during the day.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be rentable bicycle stations! They would be scattered all over the city.  You would simply put change into a machine or swipe a credit card and a bike would unlock.  You could then use it to ride all over the city.  You could return it to any other rental rack.  The racks would also have hand sanitizers and wipes so you could wipe down the public bikes before using them.  This would greatly reduce gas and emissions in the city and people would get good exercise biking around!

A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be similar to a train line, just on a smaller scale. It would pick people up in a series of pods and deposit them at their place of work for a small fee. This new train type line could also be used in the same way that a bus is, to run errands. The new system would have comfortable couch like chairs and be far more acceptable than the current forms of trnasportation availabe.

A new transportation system uses solar panel on the roads to empower vehicles to travel around the city. As vehicles get on the road, it automatically connects on the server of the roads and energies stored on boxes on street corners come one. These vehicles do not use gasoline, ethanol or diesel. It is greenhouse and uses electricity collected from the sun. Renewable energy that saves money and free to the entire residents meaning as long as the sun still shines, vehicles will work.

A new transportation system would be a large electric powered bus. It would not run on gasoline but on electricity. It would pick people up from stops and drop them off for a fee. It would also go into smaller developments to pick people up like an Uber would, but more environmentally friendly.

A new transportation system would include a mono rail system that is built above the streets and sidewalks where pedestrians can move quickly from one side of the city to the next with having to negotiate with traffic. Once you get to your train station destination there will be a system of buses who would be at the train station waiting to take you to a variety of different bus stations. The busses would pick up and drop off and would take you to and from the monorail system.
A new transportation system.... Self driving cars/ trolleys (absolutely no tracks or special lanes for the trolley just self driving)

A new trolley system with free transportation would be beneficial since the neighborhood isn't very big and it would do well for people who could be handicap. I think the new trolley system could be hybrid -- electric and gas -- which most trolleys aren't.
a new type of rail system with certain drop off points, but the rail system is above the road so it doesnt interfere with people driving cars.

A new type of transportation in my area would be like a double decker bus, but more levels. There would be different areas for kids, a lounge area, an elevator that would take you do the different levels. You would pay a monthly fee and it would have a path where it would make stops. Not just a mode of transporation, but a fun transportation where you can relax and interact with people at the same time.
a new vehicle given to everyone that works in the city, and the vehicle is super small and runs on batteries.
A new way of transportation that will change how you commute. This innovation will make commuting fun and will reduce your stress of traveling.

A new way to transport in my neighborhood? I would honestly say cabs. They are not around where I live. But a cheaper way and only in the city. It's mostly just busses and the stops are few and far between.
A online map real time of the buses and trains the area. Buses and trains aren't usually on time and having real on time traffic will show if its a bad bad to drive.
A outdoor moving walkway. Replace parts of the sidewalk with a moving walkway.
A overhanging monorail. There are a lot of key locations close together, this would be great for my town.
A path for Segways.

A pedi cab service similar to Uber. People would sign up to drive people around on their bicycles. It's a small neighborhood and could easily be done. The call service could have a phone app and website to make it easier to schedule pick ups.

A person's place of employment, such as a hospital could conceivably shuttle employees from home to work via a small bus. The city or county could be divided into quadrants to further facilitate timely pickups. This would definitely free up traffic if the workplace had 9000+ employees.
A personal transport vehicle, perhaps shaped like a scooter or segway, that collapses and folds into a backpack with straps that retract.
A phone that can also be used as a credit card.
A pick up service that allows you to rack up points for free future pick ups

A plane that also works on the ocean.

Can be dual functioning!
A pneumatic tube system similar to the mail slots in old skyscrapers. A person can just step in to a tube and be propelled to their chosen destination.

A pod/train system that runs on the shoulder of roads. It would be more active than typical buses, and be more personal in that there can be no more than 4 passengers. It would run on a track or in the future it would would run with automatic sensing software and would drive itself.
A pop-up portable gold driving range simulator that can be set up in a house, in a store, in an office. You hit the balls into a giant screen that looks like a golf course

A private luxury shuttle system, sort of like an upscale bus/uber carpool. It will pick you up and bring you to any destination. Payment is based on miles traveled and time of day. It has comfortable seats and free wifi.
A public bus system of buses the size of vans. It has an app that shows all the stops.
A public taxi system dedicated to public transportation.  Standard operating hours and funded through taxes.  On demand pick up via city based app.  Essentially eliminating everyday drivers.
A public transit teleporter using hadron cannon technology. It would break down every molecule in the body, transport them and then reassemble them. It would be painless and incredibly fast.
A public transport system with self-driving cars. You go online, select your destination and then order a self driving car to pick you up.

A quantum teleportation device that creates a temporary rip in space time that allows the users in instantly transport to any 3 dimensional coordinates in the universe. You would simply place the device on the ground and stand on it with both feet then press a remote button in your hand to start the transportation process.

A rail cart, that is powered by friction and capturing the head it produces while being driven down the rail, it starts with a simple pedal of a bike to create enough momentum and friction to start the process going and then as soon as you produce enough energy to get it moving, it will continue to produce and move forward till you press the brakes. BAM!
A rail system that goes from the outlying suburbs to the big city.
A rail system that hangs over the road where trains are suspeended from above and can carry hundreds of people
A rail system that is build from the ground up. This would be capable of high speeds typically not able to travel when driving or on another train. This would make work transit much faster.

A rail that goes back and forth from campus with known arrival times would be ideal for students to travel from campus to their homes and neighborhoods. This would be like a miniature above ground subway.

A Railway system for cars, like something out of minority report. You can still drive on the roads but the speed limit is controlled and there is never any accidents because you input your destination into a program in the individual cars and let the railway system get you there.
a railway system that goes over parts of the city and is solar powered so its more efficient.

a solar powered train that gains energy from the sun from the solar panels on the top of the train. it would run from sun up to sun down, to make sure it always has a charge. it would be sort of like a troll, but go as fast as a train.

A sort of rail line, but it's a single rail and has many hanging carts. The carts hold maybe 4 people at a time, like a taxi. a system of bikes that one can rent for free. Bike racks are located every few miles. People can use a key to scan and take out a bike, and return it at any of the racks in the area.

People who are interested in being helpful can go to this site, find out whats on their way, and scoop up the people.  Think uber, but instead of money, just get a dollar or two back on your taxes for every single person you pick up.



You'd be able to rate the drivers, and in order for them to be eligible for the write off, they'd need to maintain a high rating.  If anyone abuses it, or misses picking people up, they are barred from using it for a few months.

People would need extra room for luggage - or you could couple it with a luggage delivery system.  It would cut down on time to the beach and the number of cars on the road.

All vehicles are electric. Anyone who wishes to purchase an electric moped will receive a yearly rebate to reward them for purchasing a smaller mode of transportation that is environmentally friendly and won't congest the roads quite as much.

Along any road, there can be a big truck that bicyclists, skateboarders, roller bladers, etc can hold on to to they can get a break and a boost in speed. Alternative energy powered vehicles. Using electricity, sunlight, and other renewable sources can be beneficial to society. Imagine if every car, motorcycle, bus, stopped using gas.

An all electric bus. They would be plugged in over night and run during the day and vice versa. It would run on a normal schedule, but not run on fuel.

An alternate transportation system in my neighborhood would be a free transportation system that can take you anywhere that you like. Paying for transportation is not easy since everybody carries debit or credit cards nowadays. Hardly anybody has change or cash on them. Free transportation would be great, and it should be something other than a bus. It should just be a regular vehicle as well with a friendly driver to take you somewhere.

An alternative transport that would be excellent would be a monorail in my city.  It could be run with electricity, with many train cars, and go along the main north south route.  You could get almost anywhere in quickly and easily if it went along that route.
An alternative transportation mode would be if we could tie cables along metal poles and pull ourselves where we're going using skates.

An alternative transportation system in my neighborhood could involve something such as a taxi like service but one that ran kind of like a bus, involving general cars. An app based method of ride sharing public transit. City drivers in fuel efficient vans would respond to requested pick ups. The pick up requested by a rider would be assigned a pick up time within a short variable of the requested pick up (say 30 minutes), the van will pick up multiple parties near each other and drop them off at their destinations similar to the shared airport shuttles.
An app like Uber, except for people to just give others rides on their way to places without any monetary factor.
An app that brings together cyclist for equipment and tool sharing.

an app that takes into account both traffic and train congestion, as well as the speeds to walk or bike, to tell you the fastest mode of transport to a destination. For example, train  might typically be quicker to get from A to B, but when trains are spaced 20 minutes apart late at night and there is no traffic, driving/taxi would be faster.

An app that worked somewhat like Uber, but is for ride-sharing/car pooling.  You put in your destination, whether you can drive or not, what time you need to be to your destination, and an acceptable range for the location.  The app would look for others with similar destinations or destinations en-route for others as well as the best route to minimize drive time, but maximize people getting to their destination.  Then the app would calculate a fair percentage of the ride cost for each person based on their destination, travel distance, etc.  Public transportation here isn't great because we are so spread out.  After each ride you could rate other passengers and the driver and those ratings could be used to filter out bad users entirely or just below a certain rating level.
An app that you put recipes in. It gives you shopping lists, nutritional info, and how it fits into various diets. Especially medical ones such as for diabetes.
An app to help set up carpools.

An automated car pickup system. You connect via an app on a computer, tablet, or cell phone and let the system know the time you need to leave; it then sends a size appropriate vehicle to your door to pick you up and on your way you go!
An automated monorail like system that goes through the entire community at a regular interval day and night.

An automated system of cabs. Not cars though, more like carriages driven by AI "Horses" (Imagine that new Harley electric motorcycle engine, in a short, small, bullet shaped car like you used to see on the SIDE of a motorcycle, pulling a carriage, with an AI brain controlling it). A system like this would have the novelty and functionality of pulling people when you wanted to, or you could just use the AI 'sidecar' to run courier errands on the ground for companies that wanted fast delivery. Think like Amazon drones without the flying, the noise or the whole 'being small enough to get shot down by a .22 and stolen' thing. It keeps the battery away from the passengers if there is ever a crash, too. Which is good because those things can explode sometimes. The best thing about it, though? When it's just moving small items around for parcel delivery, it's not wasting fuel hauling an empty cab around with it. I can't stand seeing people waste so much energy driving a giant SUV around with no passengers or cargo. That act alone should be a top priority for politicians pushing for environmental reform to be talking about.

An autonomous car service. This would require the building and investing into self driving cars. You would have a mobile app you can call and request a car and one is immediately dispatched to you. Using your phone you tell it where you want to go. It navigates there. Best of all, this would be free - or very cheap.
An electric bicycle train. Everyone has their own bike, but they can all hook up to a belt that would transport them at the same speed and direction in a safe manner, maybe even on its own road.

An electric monorail with a few cars that travel between the shopping center about a mile a way from us through the little downtown and stopping at the regional rail station a mile the other direction from us. It would have 2 or 3 trains that run back and forth all day and night transporting people between those two major zones in our neighborhood, eliminating the need for cars to travel nearby.
An elevated train that ran throughout the city.

An elevated wagon wheel shaped, high speed rail system would be excellent. The outer ring would be bi-directional allowing quick transport around the city. The spokes would be bi-directional and allow quick transport from inner and outer within the quadrants.

An expansion of the skyrail or a similar system with connection to the skyrail could be added to the surrounding cities of Seattle. The addition of public transportation would cut pollution and reduce traffic congestion with the plus side of convenience. It would be a good idea to implement this idea while we still have space available, rather than wait until the problem is a burden.

An extensive network of electric vehicles that run off solar power. They sit out in the sun all day anyway, and can be shared and used as needed by the neighborhood. The neighborhood pays a monthly maintenance fee to use the vehicles. They may be used for shorter city trips.
An fleet of electric hybrid pedicabs. They could be rent by the mile or use drivers. People could use them to ride share to their destinations.

An idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood would be to use cars with automated driving that would allow the person(s) to input the destination and go about doing other things while the car drove itself to that location.

An idea for getting around my city would be public Segways or other riding devices that you could take from station to station and plug back into a machine to charge up.  Obviously, anti-theft measures would have to be in place, but this could be really great in helping people get around.

An idea I've had is the concept of personal golf carts that are used in malls, country clubs and campuses but having a few of these carts that use alternative energy methods like charging or solar power. 



They would be small and won't go at very high speeds but they could be useful for getting people in the neighborhood around for errands or nearby places while saving them money on gas and helping the environment somewhat.



It could be a small fleet the neighborhood keeps around and they are rented out to the local community for a small fee or monthly payment.
An iphone app that scans items and gives you coupons. It will save people time from having to look at the newspaper.
An old lawn mower with the blades removed.  My young daughter years ago used one as you would a four wheeler.  She loved it and got tons of miles out of it as well as fun.

An on demand bicycle system where a truck (with a trailer?) will bring a bicycle to your current location and then you can leave it in place when you're done. Reservations could be made in advance using an app.

An overhead puppy cart system, the same concept as in skii resorts. I live in NYC, and outside of traveling by train, there are no other practicals transportation which avoids traffic. Unlike the the train system, you would be able to make direct routes, with a bonus of great views around the city
An overhead rail system.
An UBer like system where neighbors help neighbors on a rotating basis.

An uber-like system for public transit busses. Riders must request pick up 24 hours ahead of time, and the bus would come to their door or as close as it could to pick the rider up. The fare could be determined by how many riders requested pick up, and drop off to a central location (downtown). From there maybe there would be additional busses that go directly to drop off points rather than on a pre-set route.
An underground hi speed railway for fast transportation.

An underground network system in the neighborhood, like a subway but only bikes and small motorcycles can travel through. This will be a good way to protect against the weather and steer clear of any incoming cars.
An underground rail system would be great. That way you could get around without having to get stuck in traffic.  There are so many cars in this area that we are known for our traffic.

An underground Seqway track which will take a while to build but will be extremely beneficial. There are no turns as underground paths are completely straight. Recharger stations are at every mile or two. There are practically no intersections or traffic lights except at major hubs, which are few and far between. Delivery services such as mail and UPS are a major component of this transportation system, which will make them faster and clear up traffic on major roads.
an underground shuttle that takes people from big landmarks to another

An underground system in my small town like a subway. But instead of a subway underground, it would be those moving sidewalks you see in the airports that you could walk or glide quickly from place to place.

An underground tunnel system just for people, bikes and mopeds.  The idea is that all the cars and congestion can stay up above and people can safely walk or transport themselves around without worrying about cars and busses getting in the way or being run over by them.  Every so often there is a ramp that allows you to exit, as well as natural light through grates and proper ventilation.  It would also be a great way to get around when it snows.
an underground walkway with people movers that go from main destinations
An underground walkway would be useful in my neighbourhood because you would not need to stop traffic to cross the street.

Another idea for a new transportation system would be a magnetic bullet train system, similar to the one they have in Japan. It would be a national rail system built over the old railroads we have now. It would go to every major city in America and would take half the time to do so.

Another idea would placing electricity-generating devices at intersections where cars come to a stop for a red light that would recharge the battery of hybrid/electric cars. This could be powered by solar panels attached to lighting poles along the road.
Any type of hoover mode of transportation allowing driver to avoid accidents and hoover past slow moving traffic.

App integrated public & private transport, using location services in smartphones to sync to trains, buses, taxis, Ubers Zipcars etc to streamline travel. Using a global integrated app to pay for any type of transport service

As a former city dweller who is now car-less in suburbia, I dream of a system of autonomous cars. The cars are available at convenient stations, much like bike rental stalls in cities. They are non-polluting. Anyone with a smart phone and account can book a ride at any time. Ride sharing is also available. These cars can have a pod design, though larger vehicles are available for people who need to transport larger items or many items. They accept voice commands, so programming is easy, and the cars can take you to almost any destination. Links to other transportation hubs, like trains and buses, are also available. The car doesn't need to be returned to its original location, just to another station. The vehicles are always well maintained and reliable, plus the service is affordable to most.

As a networking solution, all cars produced after 2017 whether self-driving or not will be installed with small wi-fi repeaters that work on the new bandwidth. They will broadcast wifi from 100 meters in each direction. The tech will be an industry standard and will be powered on at all times anonymously. Funding will come from tolls from my tube idea.

As a socially awkward recluse who doesn't drive, I want to be able to call an automated system for a driver-less taxi. I'd like to be able to pick my music genres for the ride as well.

Much more attention will be given to cyclist and pedestrian safety, with enforced ticketing for drivers that ignore traffic laws along with more bike lanes and pedestrian crossings.

AutoTram - The network of AutoTram tracks criss-cross major streets and also cut across the city in subterranean tunnels.
