I think it would be great to have a jitney-type bus that you could hail like a cab directly from the street.  The jitney would be electric powered and follow a specific route.  I think this would be great because I live in a town that has many tourists, but does not have a large population.  It could shuttle tourists to different areas, but the tourists wouldn't have to worry about a specific bus schedule.  The jitney could drive on streets that are not bus-accessible (some of our streets are "old world" and very narrow). There is also some frustration in my town about not having a vibrant night life because of lack of public transportation.  This jitney would allow people to go downtown, especially college students, and have some drinks without worrying about driving.  One of the stops would be the college campus. The jitney would have a very low fair to encourage people not to drink and drive.  This jitney would help downtown businesses and restaurants.

I'm imagining a car sharing service with locations throughout the city where you can go pick up a car without having to reserve one in advance. Nor would you have to interact with any people at the pickup/dropoff location. It would be somehow automated. Perhaps you would subscribe to the service an at annual or monthly rate and be given a special kind of 'key' that would give access to any of the cars currently at the pick up location. It would be first come first serve, and there would be smart technology embedded in both the cars and the keys. Your universal key would be linked to your account, and the car you used would transmit all relevant information to the system. Such as , time of pick up. number of miles drive. amount of gas used. Then the fees would be adjusted accordingly based on the type of car you used, miles driven, gas consumed etc. all of this without any human employees and all the fuss that comes with tradiional car rental. Things like insurance and billing info would all be done upfront when a patron sets up an account. This is genius, the more i think about it!

A ride pool system like uber that uses vans to take people to similar destinations. Like an employee car pool, but done by a third party. Blend of employee car pool, and lyft line (I think that's what it's called).
A scooter type machine that gets good gas mileage and goes faster than a normal scooter, but it has a roof and a system that protects people from outdoor elements.
a shuttle system that goes to more frequent stops
A sidewalk peoplemover based system that could run parallel to the road or existing sidewalk.
A smart car rental system where people pay per use or per hour.
A smart electric trolley hybrid system that is integrated with the current roadway network. The electric power for the network is generated by turbines in the city water supply.
A solar powered train system. That can operate during day and night time.

A solar-powered trolley system that works like an automated bus, mixed with a roller coaster.  No need for a driver, as each trolley heads to a central location and goes from different sections of neighborhoods.  They would run quickly perhaps so that  a trolley will collect people and head to its destination every 15 minutes.  It makes short transportation to hub areas cleaner, safer, and nicer, and can be closed during non-business hours of the hub area.
A subway system in my city is badly needed. We have terrible traffic and everything in the city is built in a grid system. It would save time, money and gas consumption for millions.

A subway system where you sit in a seat that attaches to a rail as soon as you are seated. You are then transported to your destination. This removes the need to wait for trains like a regular subway.

a subway type system that would have personal cars for people.  after typing in your destination, the car you were in would choose the quickest route within the city system of tracks permitted to get you to your destination. futuristic.

A system could allow cars to drive up to a rail station and be loaded onto a platform. It could be optional to have the driver stay inside for short trips or get out for longer trips. The platforms could then allow cars to be quickly transported along rail lines instead of having to consume fuel. These can be used on older less used rail tracks, making use of existing infrastructure and help clear traffic along busy highways.
A system in which no one leaves their house ever. Everything they need is brought to them by drones. They never need to leave even for vacation because virtual reality is so realistic.
A system like Uber where people can collaborate and find others who have extra space in their car for a sort of taxi/carpool service.
a system of bikes that one can rent for free. Bike racks are located every few miles. People can use a key to scan and take out a bike, and return it at any of the racks in the area.
A system of fast moving conveyor belts that help move people quickly instead of walking and driving short distances.
A system of mopeds that you leave at different stations and ride around on only paying to rent them

A system of neighborhood drivers who form a cooperative and use their own vehicles to provide transportation services. We live in a community of 1875 people in a rural area, it may not be practical, but it is doable.

A system where cars are left with the keys in them but they require a passcode to unlock that is only obtained by renting the car. It can then be parked in special spots around the city for the next person to use.

A system where there are rails above you and nothing underneath you.

You sit in a cart of sorts and you are guided along near the streets, maybe above the streets or sidewalk.

The railings connect overhead and end at each sidewalk and gives you a nice view of the neighborhood, kind of like a ski-lift.
A system with bike racks so people can rent bikes and ride around would be nice. There can be multiple areas to be rented from.
A taxi system that allows discounts for occasions when there are more than one person in the ride

A train to the beach.  The beach is about an hour from our town (or three hours with summer traffic), and all traffic to the beach comes through our town due to an important bridge.  We could have a train that leaves from our town, or other stops nearby, and then expresses to the beach.  People would need extra room for luggage - or you could couple it with a luggage delivery system.  It would cut down on time to the beach and the number of cars on the road.
A tram system that is operated by a robot where you can stop as you please and not at stations

A transportation system would include wide use of self-driving cars to facilitate efficiency and safety. Cars may be privately owned, or there may be a pay-as-you go or contract type system if you do not wish to own a vehicle. There would also be a total bike lane system for those who prefer to ride bicycles. The bike lanes would be much safer than what exists now.
a trolley system that goes through the main line of town. hop on/hop off style so that people can use it to get to work

A trolley system would be a great source of transportation, using small trolleys instead of buses.  Another Idea would be a mini bus system that primarily transported people to key areas like the train station or the airport.  A shuttle system.
A trolley, or electric street car system.

A tube system, similar to how you can send packages through tubes in factories, get people in tubes. Futurama has a concept like this, but this could be somewhat realistic. It could go pretty far and be good for the environment. It would require a better infrastructure but it would make going long distances without public transportation a viable option. Unless you consider this public trans.
A velodrome type system for bicycles.
A well established public transport system, like subway, will ease the transportation problem. It will save energy and make fewer cars on the road.
A zip line system above the ground that brings people to schools and event locations. This would be a fun innovate way to get people from one location to another.
Adding a light rail system to support the university and the surrounding apartments.
An above-ground train system. We scrapped a trolley system, and some areas can't support a subway. Above-ground might be useful for us.

An alternate transportation system in my neighborhood would be a free transportation system that can take you anywhere that you like. Paying for transportation is not easy since everybody carries debit or credit cards nowadays. Hardly anybody has change or cash on them. Free transportation would be great, and it should be something other than a bus. It should just be a regular vehicle as well with a friendly driver to take you somewhere.

An alternative transportation system in my neighborhood could involve something such as a taxi like service but one that ran kind of like a bus, involving general cars. These services could flow around the city and offer rides to people who may not be able to afford any other type of transportation.

An automated car pickup system. You connect via an app on a computer, tablet, or cell phone and let the system know the time you need to leave; it then sends a size appropriate vehicle to your door to pick you up and on your way you go!
An automated monorail like system that goes through the entire community at a regular interval day and night.

An automated system of cabs. Not cars though, more like carriages driven by AI "Horses" (Imagine that new Harley electric motorcycle engine, in a short, small, bullet shaped car like you used to see on the SIDE of a motorcycle, pulling a carriage, with an AI brain controlling it). A system like this would have the novelty and functionality of pulling people when you wanted to, or you could just use the AI 'sidecar' to run courier errands on the ground for companies that wanted fast delivery. Think like Amazon drones without the flying, the noise or the whole 'being small enough to get shot down by a .22 and stolen' thing. It keeps the battery away from the passengers if there is ever a crash, too. Which is good because those things can explode sometimes. The best thing about it, though? When it's just moving small items around for parcel delivery, it's not wasting fuel hauling an empty cab around with it. I can't stand seeing people waste so much energy driving a giant SUV around with no passengers or cargo. That act alone should be a top priority for politicians pushing for environmental reform to be talking about.

An elevated wagon wheel shaped, high speed rail system would be excellent. The outer ring would be bi-directional allowing quick transport around the city. The spokes would be bi-directional and allow quick transport from inner and outer within the quadrants.

An expansion of the skyrail or a similar system with connection to the skyrail could be added to the surrounding cities of Seattle. The addition of public transportation would cut pollution and reduce traffic congestion with the plus side of convenience. It would be a good idea to implement this idea while we still have space available, rather than wait until the problem is a burden.

An idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood would be to use cars with automated driving that would allow the person(s) to input the destination and go about doing other things while the car drove itself to that location.

An on demand bicycle system where a truck (with a trailer?) will bring a bicycle to your current location and then you can leave it in place when you're done. Reservations could be made in advance using an app.

An overhead puppy cart system, the same concept as in skii resorts. I live in NYC, and outside of traveling by train, there are no other practicals transportation which avoids traffic. Unlike the the train system, you would be able to make direct routes, with a bonus of great views around the city
An overhead rail system.
An UBer like system where neighbors help neighbors on a rotating basis.

An uber-like system for public transit busses. Riders must request pick up 24 hours ahead of time, and the bus would come to their door or as close as it could to pick the rider up. The fare could be determined by how many riders requested pick up, and drop off to a central location (downtown). From there maybe there would be additional busses that go directly to drop off points rather than on a pre-set route.

An underground network system in the neighborhood, like a subway but only bikes and small motorcycles can travel through. This will be a good way to protect against the weather and steer clear of any incoming cars.
An underground rail system would be great. That way you could get around without having to get stuck in traffic.  There are so many cars in this area that we are known for our traffic.

An underground Seqway track which will take a while to build but will be extremely beneficial. There are no turns as underground paths are completely straight. Recharger stations are at every mile or two. There are practically no intersections or traffic lights except at major hubs, which are few and far between. Delivery services such as mail and UPS are a major component of this transportation system, which will make them faster and clear up traffic on major roads.

An underground system in my small town like a subway. But instead of a subway underground, it would be those moving sidewalks you see in the airports that you could walk or glide quickly from place to place.

An underground tunnel system just for people, bikes and mopeds.  The idea is that all the cars and congestion can stay up above and people can safely walk or transport themselves around without worrying about cars and busses getting in the way or being run over by them.  Every so often there is a ramp that allows you to exit, as well as natural light through grates and proper ventilation.  It would also be a great way to get around when it snows.

Another idea for a new transportation system would be a magnetic bullet train system, similar to the one they have in Japan. It would be a national rail system built over the old railroads we have now. It would go to every major city in America and would take half the time to do so.

As a former city dweller who is now car-less in suburbia, I dream of a system of autonomous cars. The cars are available at convenient stations, much like bike rental stalls in cities. They are non-polluting. Anyone with a smart phone and account can book a ride at any time. Ride sharing is also available. These cars can have a pod design, though larger vehicles are available for people who need to transport larger items or many items. They accept voice commands, so programming is easy, and the cars can take you to almost any destination. Links to other transportation hubs, like trains and buses, are also available. The car doesn't need to be returned to its original location, just to another station. The vehicles are always well maintained and reliable, plus the service is affordable to most.

As a socially awkward recluse who doesn't drive, I want to be able to call an automated system for a driver-less taxi. I want the option to pay online via debit/credit, gift card or Paypal or have the option to insert bills into the car door before being able to enter. I'd like to be able to pick my music genres for the ride as well.

Atlanta could have a much, much wider public transportation system. The subway would go to many different neighborhoods, extending in different directions instead of being a simple cross. More money and attention would be given to public transportation, extending bus and trolley service while halting the neverending expansion of parking and roads. Much more attention will be given to cyclist and pedestrian safety, with enforced ticketing for drivers that ignore traffic laws along with more bike lanes and pedestrian crossings.
Automated bus lines that run to every street in America. Something similar to a trolley system, without the rails.
Automated driverless car systems - eliminate car ownership and use a network of public self-driving cars to travel
Autorickshaw : In Chennai, India, people travel in autorickshaw for short and long distances and here we have sharing system of auto also.
Being an extensive cable car system

Bicycles with wheels like trains are placed on rails and whoever is going to the market takes this bsicycle and with little bit of paddling the bicycle can reach the destination. There should be distance system where two bicycles should be impossible to collide.
biking system, where people can rent bikes and use them and drop them off at other stations.

Chicago - Chicago has a great system and phenomenal public transport. As far as transportation though I wish the highways in the city acted like slotted cars, similar to trains in which in every highway entrance there would be a dedicated lane/railway for vehicles to travel at fast speeds like trains. This would reduce traffic and travel times.
Create an underground rail system that allows people to travel to all major hubs of the city. This would save gas and ease pollution.

Currently, I live in a small town that has a public transportation system. However, you have to call and wait for the bus to pick you up, instead of waiting at a pre-determined stop, and it can take forever to get where you're going. I propose a busing system that's like the one in bigger cities for my neighborhood. People could still call and wait for a bus, but buses should also stop and pick people up at predetermined stops at regular intervals.

Currently, my city is very underserved by the public transportation system. I believe that the existing public transit should be expanded with a greater fleet of buses, so that all people in my community could be served. The buses currently in operation only reach about half (if that) of the city's occupants, leaving many without an opportunity to get where they need to go quickly and affordably.
Driverless cars, it's the only thing I can imagine being different in my neighborhood.  We do not have room for new rail systems.

Each neighborhood gets together to say what time they will be leaving that has a automatic system that will call and tell everyone in the neighborhood or in short distance where they are going and when they are leaving.  That way they can catch a ride with others and not have to guess where or when they are leaving. It could be like a carpool system where everywhere you go it will auto call if that person is gong to another location and you still have room in your vehicle.
Electric buses would be an amazing addition to my city but we would have to integrate a system of cables that the city may or may not support. San Francisco has the ones I mean.

Electric camper style van. This would be completely powered by electricity and allow people to live in their vehicle. This would allow the electric system in the car to work synonymous with the electric system in the camper.
Everything would be done through a smartphone app. It would be a transport system that gathers everyone together with common interests. It would be a way to make friends and get to your destination.

Express subway lines would be nice.  WMATA is a terrible system.  But I'd be happy if we could get some sidewalks and bike lanes in our neighborhood.  A real help would be a circulator bus system for the neighborhoods surrounding our subway station.  The current system runs point to point and doesn't reduce car trips to the grocery store and local mall.
flying transportation system will be very famous in future for example flying car, flying scatter board bike and so

Fully automated system of public transit; similar in function to a subway but smaller and without drivers (more like the automated tram systems used at airports). Probably using driverless car technology so it could utilize existing roadways? You would use a passcard to enter a specialized waiting area, like a covered bus stop, at which the driverless vehicle/tram/etc would stop at and allow entry (only to those allowed into the station; maybe functions like the turnstiles in a subway?). Vehicle would be the size of a small city bus but could connect to some city-run data network to find and avoid traffic stops and slowdowns (and use/switch between already existing bus lanes and subway tracks?). It could have its own roadway/railway too but it would be nice to not have to create something new. It would be more reliable than a bus system, which is rarely on time where I live, but more accessible than a subway/railway, which does not reach enough areas of my city for me to use frequently.
Future transportation system in my neighborhood could be a electric bicycle taxi system where neighborhood resents can take shorts trips like the grocery store or sending kids off to school.
Have a monorail system around town. It'll reduce pollution because people will have fun using it instead of driving their cars.
Have a system of moving sidewalks that has chairs (with seatbelt for safety) mounted to it. People can just sit down and be transported quickly throughout the city.

Have a system of sidewalk rail cars that attaches to the sidewalks of a city. Each rail car can carry passenger anywhere in the city to any destination and stop at any time on its route. This system of transportation will greatly reduce city congestion while doesn't interfere with any of the vehicles that are already on the road.
Have a system of skylift that can transport people within the city. This could really reduce traffic congestion. This network goes above the ground traffic and moves quickly.

Have a transportation system in the city where there is a tunneling system filled miniature train with small passenger capacity. These miniature trains can take people directly to their destination and the best part is that because they are small, there can be a large number of them running underneath the city.
Having a neighborhood run community bus system. It would be exclusively a bus for people in the neighborhood to travel short distances.

Having some sort of electric train that runs underground, just like the subway system in New York. The city that I currently live in doesn't have that option so having some sort of underground transportation system that runs all around the city constantly would make commuting much better for everyone.
Help public transit bring people to holiday events,fairs, festivals and sporting events in my community. Be sure to  with my local public transit system

hoverboard system

electric only vehicles, or vehicles only powered by electricity

How about a rent-a-Segway system? You would probably need some sort of point of sale system for a deposit on the Segway, but otherwise the city could price it however they wanted.
Hyperloop system that connects various California cities through ultra-fast tunnels

I also think there can be drones that can transport people flying at low altitudes way below planes so as not to disrupt plane systems. They can be coordinated in a central place to that there are no crashes, and the drones can be as autonomous as possible to avoid human error.

I am from Cincinnati, and one new mode of transportation that would be great here is a subway system. Tunnels already exist from a failed project decades ago, but with the growth the city has seen, it could be a viable option.

I am thinking about a flying transport system. It should fly with balloon or air system. It should not need engine or fuel. So expence would be cheap. It should occupy 15-25 people at a time. It moves with air adjustment, drag, thrust, pressure etc. The flyer lands every important point in a city. So people can travel across the city with less time and money. No traffic block, signals, air pollution etc.

I am thinking of something like a city bus system but for uber. Rather than having to go from stop to stop and hope people are there the bus system can be smarter and go to the most packed stops or to those who have been waiting the longest based upon when they clicked the app. It would be much more efficient.

I am visually a bus like transportation system that travels on something like rails which are suspended from above.  The rails are not supported by concrete systems from below.  Specialized buses will travel on these rails without causing disruption of regular road traffic.  When it nears a bus stop, the bus will stop and drop itself down to the level of the regular roads, open the door and let the passengers in and out.  Once the door closes it will climb up to the to the level of the suspended rails and travel forward on the rails.
I believe a good future transportation system for my city would be a highspeed lightrail that can get people to their stop quickly and completely safely
I believe mobile sidewalks are a good idea. They could be on a conveyor system similar to escalators but on a flat plane and a bigger scale.
I believe my neighborhood should have some sort of electronic trolley system.  I can take multiple people throughout the day and network workers to certain destinations and landmarks.

I believe that we should have personalized rail system fro our neighborhood. The whole nei8ghborhhod should have a few of them available to different destinations. When someone wants to go there they hit a button and it sends it to them.

I can see a transport type system where someone steps on a pad and it transport them digitally over to where they want to go within a town. kinda like the thing they had in willy wonkas chocolate factory but without the death ray pointer thing it would be just a pad like a dance dance revolution pad.
I could see a trolley style system that ran on solar panels so that there would be no wires hanging.

I don't anticipate the transportation system changing too much in my area no matter the time frame. I think the car will rule for the next several decades, but I would like the cars to change. They need not be so huge, and would be powered by plug-in type electrical engines. Each home would have a solar array and this would power your home, and your car. A back-up natural gas power plant would help out if it's cloudy for weeks. Cars would be there for longer trips, but I would also like to see normal bicycle travel increase in the small city I live in. People are fat, lazy, and gross. We don't need anymore technology to go 100 yards, just less lazy people.
I envision a new transportation system where we use old school busses to transport people to work.  The busses should be turned into green vehicles electric, hybrid or the like.
I feel like there could be a uber shuttle, sort of like a train system.

I get out of my house and before I leave my apartment on my 12th floor I just press a button on my app on my phone to type a location of the place i need to go.This would in turn contact all local data base systems of GPS based transport systems irrespective of the vendors available or government supported transport systems which include Cabs,Buses,Trains,Subway,3 Wheelers and most importantly assuming the people of the future will care a lot more about the environment and all the people who are going alone in a 5 seater car would have a option of sharing there carbon footprint left by the vehicle.And if the co-ordinates of the person with the car and the co-ordinates of the Person who is using the app matches then a Random Unique (one time use)Number or Picture or Anything which would be visible from atleast 10 feet away on a Min 6 inch screen.However this interface can be avoided by tracking the dots on the GPS system or by sending a snap shot of the car number or a photo of the person himself which will be destroyed automatically by the system once the person is down from the Vehicle.Punch Line Before I get to the main gates of the apartment.I should have the list of Vehicles available to me and the time it would take the vehicle to reach my place based on GPS and traffic conditions and also how much time would it take to reach my destination again based on real time traffic conditions and also most importantly.if i take  the public transport system.How much time would it take to reach the same destination and also how much Carbon foot print would i save from doing it.And also the time required by the vehicle to reach the local transport systems if it is not a walkable distance.There are many more ,But i think that is enough for the day.

GIVE THE CUSTOMER ALL THE POSSIBLE OPTIONS OF COMMUTING WITH THE CARBON FOOTPRINT AND THE COST AND THE TIME INVOLVED IRRESPECTIVE OF THE VENDOR OR GOVERNMENT SYSTEMS...

I have recently returned a small-to-mid-sized city (60,000+ people, down from over 125,000 at its peak) after 20 years, and the public transportation system here is non-existent, Uber does not exist here (the nearest key city of 250,000+ people is 40 miles away), and there are 2 very small taxi companies which are not cost-effective or nearby enough to be efficient to use. In a situation like this, any alternative transportation would be beneficial, as this is a city where without a car/traditional vehicle, your ability to get even basic errands accomplished is compromised greatly. The city cited low ridership and rising fuel costs to keep the giant, hulking city buses operating as the reason for cancelling the public routes. My proposal would be to have smaller, and highly fuel-efficient modified Sprinter vans, each serving one small portion of the community, and running a smaller amount of the fleet during off-peak hours. This would allow the most economical and efficient model for the community to have access to needed transportation.

I have seen a lot on the news lately about 'self-driving' cars, and I think it would be neat if this technology could someday be applied to public transportation. I think 'self driving' buses would be an excellent mode of transportation. I think this would be particularly useful for smaller cities or towns that can't afford to have subway systems. Self driving buses could be programmed to stop at every stop timely and efficiently and could save the city money by eliminating the need to hire drivers and would cut out the issue of human error when it comes to being on time, not showing up for work, or causing accidents.
I imagine a magnetic public hovercraft system that goes to individual homes on a grid.
I imagine a railway system that goes through my town and all around the united states. It would be a bullet train like they have in europe that hovers and goes fast. It would be affordable too.
I imagine a train system that runs parallel to the street but is separated from it, unlike a streetcar. It could be elevated from the terrain when necessary to cross over obstacles.

I imagine a transportation system in which we all use underground super chutes. They move us from place to place within our town super fast. It would have to be set up so everything is safe of course. I imagine a network of these chutes spreading throughout the city and they pop you up wherever you want to go. Wouldn't that be amazing?

I imagine a type of highway for bicycles where people can use on and off ramps easily to reach their destination. They wont have to worry about cars since its a bike only highway system. it will get people to their destination quicker since they dont have to stop at traffic lights and watch out for pedestrians.

I imagine a type of hybrid car/rail system that are not owned by individuals.  A person would schedule a pickup to go to work and one home.  The cars would keep circulating picking up and dropping off people all day.  There would be much lesser need for personal parking as well.

I imagine an electric trolley like those old school ones, but it would be a hybrid system instead and people could hang off the back and ride it. There would be electronic pass cards that everyone could swipe on and off and it would be subsidized so anyone could use it for super cheap.

I live in a neighborhood near an excellent metro system, but not walkable to it. I would like a people-mover sort of system that travels through the neighborhood making the existing metro station more accessible. Perhaps small cars or pods at the end of each street that travel along an elevated rail directly to the metro station.

I live in a pretty population dense area where most things people need (like a hospital, a big job center, homes, grocery store) are pretty close to each other.  I think this set up begs for a monorail.  It would be elevated so wouldn't interfere with current traffic too much, but would provide a nice transportation system for people to take for short trips.

I live in a small town so I think the future transportation system in my neighborhood will be to get rid of normal sized roads and create bike and walking paths all over town. I can see the current roads changing to smaller lanes made for electric vehicles while most of the transportation needs will be fulfilled with bike and walking paths and personal hoverboard type of transportation.

I live in a town with a lot of freight trains. A subway system would be nice because it would get us places faster (the town is large in size and spread out over several miles) and be able to bypass the trains, which stop constantly. The subway would run either over the existing trains or under them and run off of cards that were prepaid like the MTAs.

I live in an area where there are a lot of senior citizens so driving can sometimes be scary, and I think this city would greatly benefit from public transportation. However, I think something that would benefit the environment would be the most helpful, so I think pushcarts would be a lot of fun, or even horse drawn carriages. Not only would these be better for the environment, but I think the older people would appreciate the old-fashioned nature of such public transport systems.

I live in the suburbs so all the rail lines converge on the central city. It would be nice if there was a light rail system that linked the different major suburbs together. You could connect it to the lines going to the city and across the country.

I live near the water, so water transportation would be nice to have. It could be a system of ferries that can go from port to port, carrying passengers like a bus system. This would reduce the amount of cars on the road and the amount of traffic.

I lived in Japan and really enjoyed their system of underground rail. I think most cities in the United States could benefit from such a system, which has the added benefit of cutting down on DUIs. There is no rail system in my town.

I often thought that a sort of ski lift-type system would work well to carry people from my neighborhood to downtown.  You would board a continuously running chair on wire, and then would be transported to a downtown station riding on the chair over the city. Would take ten minutes max to board and 10-15 minutes to go downtown.

I picture a brand new train system, going down the main street, with street cars going leading up to the main street.   I would love to see it being a high speed system, paying with your fingerprints.   It would be similar to a credit card.

I think a bullet train would be very useful. A train that can transport passengers fast in between the major areas in the neighborhood, for example to schools, the downtown area, the performing arts theater, shopping districts, the airport etc. It doesn't have to stop very often like a bus but an instead be used for getting between major areas and can be supported by the bus system.

I think a drone transport system that would carry people, good and other items would be a great service.  An even better idea is if was peer run, meaning run by people in your neighborhood, and all the profits would be split.

It would have to be a town that doesn't get very cold in the winter, like where I live, where people could use their bikes comfortably year round. I think a method that would improve the transportation system would be to change how turn lanes are handled in America. I'm envisioning a system of small feet-sized platforms, along with a handle at arm-height, running on street-level light rail tracks throughout the city. I'm imagining a car sharing service with locations throughout the city where you can go pick up a car without having to reserve one in advance. Perhaps you would subscribe to the service an at annual or monthly rate and be given a special kind of 'key' that would give access to any of the cars currently at the pick up location. It would be first come first serve, and there would be smart technology embedded in both the cars and the keys. Your universal key would be linked to your account, and the car you used would transmit all relevant information to the system. Such as , time of pick up. number of miles drive. amount of gas used. Then the fees would be adjusted accordingly based on the type of car you used, miles driven, gas consumed etc. all of this without any human employees and all the fuss that comes with tradiional car rental. Things like insurance and billing info would all be done upfront when a patron sets up an account. This is genius, the more i think about it!

My idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood is a series of really big tubes, with padding, and occasionally air holes, with mesh filters to prevent bugs and large debris from getting in.  The tubes would be places alongside all the streets, and be at a constant forward vacuum, with enough lessening of suction to allow people to grasp a handle at their stop and get out.   (If you miss your stop, you just ride around until it comes up again, pushing yourself towards the right tube as it comes towards you.)



Collision between travelers would need to be solved, as well as how to clean up any errant body fluids left by travelers; perhaps a daily purge at midnight, where the suction could be increased exponentially and all materials dumped in a pile, on a rotating schedule, on different people's lawns.   



This system has the benefit of a very low carbon footprint, and lends itself well to spontaneous exclamations of 'cowabunga'.  



Implementation note: This idea may require anti-gravity research, in addition to a lot of suction.

My idea for public transportation would include an underground rail system powered by magnets. Because of the varied climate as well as prevalence natural disasters in my area, having the system underground seems like the best idea. The train would stop a lot more often than normal trains; At the end of every street at least. My idea is of a drive-on subway. Just like cars can be driven onto ferries, where a person can stay in there car while the ferry transports them across the water and then drive off the ferry onto land again once the ferry has reached its destination, drive-on subways would allow something similar. Certain stops would not be for people boarding, but for cars. The cars would go into specialized compartments and the drivers would be required to stay in their vehicles so as not to cause any danger. The cars would be allowed to drive off of the subway vehicle at certain stops too. This way, people could be using both the subway system and their cars at the same time, so they end up with the benefits of both! The subway can take them somewhere along its route, and their car can take them the rest of the way where the subway doesn't go. It would cut down on traffic and probably encourage people to take the subway even when they're not using their car. A lot of people are hesitant to try public transit, but once they try it, they find it efficient, so this would really show people how efficient it can be. 

While on board the subway, the people in cars would see lights in their compartment, just like a stoplight, telling them when it is okay to drive off. The doors would automatically open at every stop where cars are allowed to exit, and then a green light would go on that the driver could easily see, so they'd know it's their time to drive off. When it turns to yellow, it means the doors are closing soon, so the driver should either hurry up or choose to stay on. Of course, the doors would have motion-sensors so they wouldn't close on a car either way. There would also be maps inside each compartment with cars showing where the stops are, so a driver can prepare for where they need to get off at.

Some sort of free bicycle rides.  It would work by having you use a credit card (so people cannot steal bicycles) as a deposit.   Here's how it would work.  You would walk/visit some sort of kiosk, swipe your card and it would unlock a bicycle from a rack.  You are then free to ride it.  You can then return it to the same kiosk, or perhaps to one further away/new destination and as long as you swipe the credit card again upon returning the bike -- it would clear your deposit.   If you don't return the bike within a reasonable amount of time (say 2 days or so), you could charge the person the price of the bike plus some penalty.   This method won't make much money if free, but you could also setup a rental type system.   Just imagine lots of kiosks around a city, with say 12 or so bikes are each one, and people could rent/ride as needed.  Like a Uhaul type service for bikes.   From a network perspective, I guess it would be like sending a packet to a new location downstream, and the returning of the bike would be the acknowledgment.    If you don't return the bike, it would charge your card aka ask for a retransmission of said packet.  That's all I have for now.

This idea is called 'Rolling taxi'. The system is a large ball. single large ball. Inside the ball, people can sit . People sit or stand at the centre of the ball. As ball rolls on specially made road the centre region doesn't move. The centre region where people sit is attached to the  inner surface of the ball in a special manner so that people do not move. The speed and direction of the ball can control using technology. The ball roll all across the city with people inside on a special track. Speed is high and expense is less. Also it is fun.

This idea would have to be built in a city near a river, or attached to a solar farm because it relies on using naturally produced hydroelectric or solar power. Basically, it's a train on an electrified track, that moves slowly and stops at intervals in a big loop throughout a city. It would make stops the same way buses make stops. If you rode it long enough, you'd wind up at the same stop you got on at.  It relies completely on green energy, no exhaust just some electric motors driving the cars. The main idea is it would be free and the city could tax businesses a small amount for serving their parts of town, just to help pay maintenance costs.

This is about a single user system. It is similar to a bicycle. But it's does not run on road. It has specific path made only for this vehicle like a railway track. The track has frictionless surface. The bottom of the vehicle is also frictionless. The vehicle does not have round wheels. But instead flat frictionless bottom (but also can be frictionless wheel). Vehicle does not need fuel. First we clips the vehicle to the track manually. We sit and unclip the vehicle from the track and apply some mechanical force just like in the bicycle to move forward. After that the vehicle moves without any force. Because there is no friction.We just sit and relax. When we apply brake, clips is attached the bottom of track and it stops. The track should be spread all across the city. Vehicle is portable. We take it from home or rent from government.

We ought to revisit the trolley system because the buses in New York City are plagued by heavy traffic. We should have electric trolleys on main thoroughfares. It worked in the old days. Sometimes old ideas mixed with new technology is GENIUS!

what is needed is a tubular powered zipline based transportation system. a combination of pnewumatic and electric power will propel people from place to place in a similar manner to a ski lift except it would just be a small tube that has a chain of sorts running in it along the sidewalks. all you would have to do is to have a harness on and when you need to go to one of the destinations you hook on to the line that is color coded for your destination and cruise on down there. What we need is a better public transportation system that services the East end of the city.  Perhaps a bullet shuttle that will pick up in certain areas of the East End, and shuttle t predetermined locations within the city such as the downtown area, in addition to other areas.

I'm imagining a car sharing service with locations throughout the city where you can go pick up a car without having to reserve one in advance. Nor would you have to interact with any people at the pickup/dropoff location. It would be somehow automated. Perhaps you would subscribe to the service an at annual or monthly rate and be given a special kind of 'key' that would give access to any of the cars currently at the pick up location. It would be first come first serve, and there would be smart technology embedded in both the cars and the keys. Your universal key would be linked to your account, and the car you used would transmit all relevant information to the system. Such as , time of pick up. number of miles drive. amount of gas used. Then the fees would be adjusted accordingly based on the type of car you used, miles driven, gas consumed etc. all of this without any human employees and all the fuss that comes with tradiional car rental. Things like insurance and billing info would all be done upfront when a patron sets up an account. This is genius, the more i think about it!

My small rural town doesn't even have an intact bus system, so anything would be better than it is now. But I would like a service that has people who drive pick up trucks to help you move things. A bike path that has a divider between the road and the bike path. A dedicated bike path that has a sense of security could encourage more people to bike around town since they wouldn't need to share the road with cars.
A bike path that is in place of all the roads. No cars will be allowed. There will be no worrying about being hit by a car when riding your bike.
A bunch of self driving cars that will replace buses and taxis. The will have free wifi and be very cheap.

A central hub for a ridesharing service that provides cars for small groups to take to neighboring towns. I live in a rural area, a few minutes from a very small village. A community system that is managed electronically and requests cars any time of day. All cars are electric and will take you anywhere you want to go for a set charge and there are maintenance teams that come and clean cars during the day.
A company that picks you up in a car of your choice.

A fare based system would allow heavy car users to pay more and light ones to pay less for gas, tolls, etc.  Their car will have a gps tracker to see where and when they go (downtown, rush hour, etc.)  This will help the people who don't need to drive as much and tax the ones that are always on the road.

A fleet of automated cars that have pre-programmed destinations in them. You use your credit or debit card to pay. a fun car that always tells jokes to the passengers

A human-sized slot-car system.  Where cars run independently self-driving down a track through electricity like a trolley car, but just big enough for a regular sized family (in other words size of a regular car). A monorail system that is above everyone.  There would be rail cars on it that go in a multitude of directions.  People can still use the other forms of transportation, but this form would be strictly for people looking to get around in the city.  They would park their cars before entering the city, and use this quick system for getting around.  No more crowded, expensive parking in the city.

A moving sidewalk - like the ones you would see in an airport to help expedite movement between terminals. Having mechanical walkways would enable people to do their shopping but reduce their need to use cars, and at the same time set all their bags down so they don't have to figure out how to lug them home, especially if they've purchased something heavy.  It could also allow people to get where they need to go faster, if they continue to walk along the moving sidewalk.  They could sit alongside regular sidewalks, so people who still wanted to go out for a walk and get some fresh air could do so.  The mechanical/moving sidewalks would be made out of metal, look like a flat escalator, have hand railings, and each side of the road would have a sidewalk that goes the same way as traffic.

A network of publicly available electric cars will drive around the city in the most efficient manner possible. People will use apps to call a car to get them =from one of many pickup spots and drop them off before they go on the next passenger.
A network of self driving cars on demand.  You set your pickup time and location via app, as well as destination and desired arrival time.
A network of self driving cars that are owned by the community. When you need one, you just summon one like Uber.

A new carpool system. You get together with a group of people at a park and ride. Park your car there and commute in a van with a group of people to work. This save gas and some of you can nap while the other is driving.
A new innovative transportation system would be automated cars. They can pick you up and drop you off wherever you need to be.

A new taxi service that uses mopeds rather than cars. It's something used quite frequently in other countries (such as Brazil). You would be able to call for assistance or simply stop them off the side of the road (just like a taxi, obviously).

A new transportation idea would be to have bikes that can be rented.  I have seen this in some towns such as Austin, Texas.  Where you can find a bank of rental bikes every couple of blocks.  How awesome would it be if this was more normal and people could choose to ride a bike to the store to grab a loaf of bread or something, rather than getting in the car and wasting gas and adding to pollution.

A new transportation system for my neighborhood would be a uber-like bus service. Buses have specific routes, and can stop at any point on that route if you use the service. That way you can have one pick you up close to your house instead of having to drop your car off at a bus station.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood could be the use of drones to fly individuals in and around town, or to far off destinations. The drones would fly like helicopters, but can  can also be controlled using a remote control. A new transportation system.... Self driving cars/ trolleys (absolutely no tracks or special lanes for the trolley just self driving)
a new type of rail system with certain drop off points, but the rail system is above the road so it doesnt interfere with people driving cars.
A public transport system with self-driving cars. You go online, select your destination and then order a self driving car to pick you up.

A Railway system for cars, like something out of minority report. You can still drive on the roads but the speed limit is controlled and there is never any accidents because you input your destination into a program in the individual cars and let the railway system get you there.

A ride pool system like uber that uses vans to take people to similar destinations. Like an employee car pool, but done by a third party. Blend of employee car pool, and lyft line (I think that's what it's called).

A roaming private car that you can pay by the mile or carpool. Basically, the car would go up and down the street or area and put trips together (like going to the grocery store or the same shopping center) and split the costs, so it can be as affordable as a bus but more private.
A self driving lawn mower.  Use the technology for self driving cars to create a self driving lawn mower.
a service in which you get picked up by a car and earn points you can redeem for free rides

A small personal car that ran on solar energy that was no larger than a bike.  It could be stored on a bike rack and had enough energy to go 15 miles on a charge. a small size car , it might fit only for one person as motorcycle but it's closed like cars
A smart car rental system where people pay per use or per hour.

A specific lane in which you have to pay money to use.  It could be like 30-40 a month, there is a microchip in the car that can tell if you don't belong there, and it alerts the police.  This lane money could go to taxes/education and the like.  The lane is only restricted to paying customers during regular work hours.   Any other time it's not policed, and anyone can use it.

a subway type system that would have personal cars for people.  after typing in your destination, the car you were in would choose the quickest route within the city system of tracks permitted to get you to your destination. futuristic.

A system could allow cars to drive up to a rail station and be loaded onto a platform. It could be optional to have the driver stay inside for short trips or get out for longer trips. The platforms could then allow cars to be quickly transported along rail lines instead of having to consume fuel. These can be used on older less used rail tracks, making use of existing infrastructure and help clear traffic along busy highways.
A system like Uber where people can collaborate and find others who have extra space in their car for a sort of taxi/carpool service.

A system where cars are left with the keys in them but they require a passcode to unlock that is only obtained by renting the car. It can then be parked in special spots around the city for the next person to use.
A taxi service where self-driving cars can be dispatched to a client which then drive the client to their destination and then return to HQ.

A train to the beach.  The beach is about an hour from our town (or three hours with summer traffic), and all traffic to the beach comes through our town due to an important bridge.  We could have a train that leaves from our town, or other stops nearby, and then expresses to the beach.  People would need extra room for luggage - or you could couple it with a luggage delivery system.  It would cut down on time to the beach and the number of cars on the road.

A transportation system would include wide use of self-driving cars to facilitate efficiency and safety. Cars may be privately owned, or there may be a pay-as-you go or contract type system if you do not wish to own a vehicle. There would also be a total bike lane system for those who prefer to ride bicycles. The bike lanes would be much safer than what exists now.
A trolley, or electric street car system.
A type of uber service that transports more than a car of people.

A walking pathway across every rooftop in the city.   It would cut down on danger from cars, and it'd be fun to see the scenery.  This could easily be constructed with some good, sturdy planks.  Line them up on the roof, screw them in or hammer them in.  Every building would have a fire escape on it for easy access back to the street.  This would save much time as you could go "as the eagle flies." straight across the roofs.

A way that cars can connect with other cars so if you are all going to the same place they can connect GPS and it would allow the cars to follow automatically the car in the front and use less gas that way.

A way to connect your car with a mobile phone app - you would broadcast your intended route (such as commuting home from work) and share this route with people in your local area. For a small fee (under $5) - someone could ask to "Ride Along" with you along your route - but with no deviations - they would be allowed to get out along the way, but not change your intended path of travel.
A way to have not cars on the street but have a series of pullies that connect the houses so we can all move around with our kids.
A well established public transport system, like subway, will ease the transportation problem. It will save energy and make fewer cars on the road.
Alternative energy powered vehicles. Using electricity, sunlight, and other renewable sources can be beneficial to society. Imagine if every car, motorcycle, bus, stopped using gas.

An alternative transport that would be excellent would be a monorail in my city.  It could be run with electricity, with many train cars, and go along the main north south route.  You could get almost anywhere in quickly and easily if it went along that route.

An alternative transportation system in my neighborhood could involve something such as a taxi like service but one that ran kind of like a bus, involving general cars. These services could flow around the city and offer rides to people who may not be able to afford any other type of transportation.

An automated car pickup system. You connect via an app on a computer, tablet, or cell phone and let the system know the time you need to leave; it then sends a size appropriate vehicle to your door to pick you up and on your way you go!

An automated system of cabs. Not cars though, more like carriages driven by AI "Horses" (Imagine that new Harley electric motorcycle engine, in a short, small, bullet shaped car like you used to see on the SIDE of a motorcycle, pulling a carriage, with an AI brain controlling it). A system like this would have the novelty and functionality of pulling people when you wanted to, or you could just use the AI 'sidecar' to run courier errands on the ground for companies that wanted fast delivery. Think like Amazon drones without the flying, the noise or the whole 'being small enough to get shot down by a .22 and stolen' thing. It keeps the battery away from the passengers if there is ever a crash, too. Which is good because those things can explode sometimes. The best thing about it, though? When it's just moving small items around for parcel delivery, it's not wasting fuel hauling an empty cab around with it. I can't stand seeing people waste so much energy driving a giant SUV around with no passengers or cargo. That act alone should be a top priority for politicians pushing for environmental reform to be talking about.

An autonomous car service. This would require the building and investing into self driving cars. You would have a mobile app you can call and request a car and one is immediately dispatched to you. Using your phone you tell it where you want to go. It navigates there. Best of all, this would be free - or very cheap.

An electric monorail with a few cars that travel between the shopping center about a mile a way from us through the little downtown and stopping at the regional rail station a mile the other direction from us. It would have 2 or 3 trains that run back and forth all day and night transporting people between those two major zones in our neighborhood, eliminating the need for cars to travel nearby.

An idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood would be to use cars with automated driving that would allow the person(s) to input the destination and go about doing other things while the car drove itself to that location.

An underground network system in the neighborhood, like a subway but only bikes and small motorcycles can travel through. This will be a good way to protect against the weather and steer clear of any incoming cars.
An underground rail system would be great. That way you could get around without having to get stuck in traffic.  There are so many cars in this area that we are known for our traffic.

An underground tunnel system just for people, bikes and mopeds.  The idea is that all the cars and congestion can stay up above and people can safely walk or transport themselves around without worrying about cars and busses getting in the way or being run over by them.  Every so often there is a ramp that allows you to exit, as well as natural light through grates and proper ventilation.  It would also be a great way to get around when it snows.

Another idea would placing electricity-generating devices at intersections where cars come to a stop for a red light that would recharge the battery of hybrid/electric cars. This could be powered by solar panels attached to lighting poles along the road.

As a former city dweller who is now car-less in suburbia, I dream of a system of autonomous cars. The cars are available at convenient stations, much like bike rental stalls in cities. They are non-polluting. Anyone with a smart phone and account can book a ride at any time. Ride sharing is also available. These cars can have a pod design, though larger vehicles are available for people who need to transport larger items or many items. They accept voice commands, so programming is easy, and the cars can take you to almost any destination. Links to other transportation hubs, like trains and buses, are also available. The car doesn't need to be returned to its original location, just to another station. The vehicles are always well maintained and reliable, plus the service is affordable to most.

As a networking solution, all cars produced after 2017 whether self-driving or not will be installed with small wi-fi repeaters that work on the new bandwidth. They will broadcast wifi from 100 meters in each direction. The tech will be an industry standard and will be powered on at all times anonymously. Funding will come from tolls from my tube idea.

As a socially awkward recluse who doesn't drive, I want to be able to call an automated system for a driver-less taxi. I want the option to pay online via debit/credit, gift card or Paypal or have the option to insert bills into the car door before being able to enter. I'd like to be able to pick my music genres for the ride as well.

Automated cars that can come pick you up at the push of a button on android or apple devices, and directly from that device, you can pick from a map where you want to go. Submit your payment, and off you go!
Automated driverless car systems - eliminate car ownership and use a network of public self-driving cars to travel

For transportation in my neighborhood we have cars, and buses. The most popular mode of transportation being the four door family sedan type car. Free car services to parents with kids in school.  Too cold to walk in the frigid weather.

Fully automated system of public transit; similar in function to a subway but smaller and without drivers (more like the automated tram systems used at airports). Probably using driverless car technology so it could utilize existing roadways? I get out of my house and before I leave my apartment on my 12th floor I just press a button on my app on my phone to type a location of the place i need to go.This would in turn contact all local data base systems of GPS based transport systems irrespective of the vendors available or government supported transport systems which include Cabs,Buses,Trains,Subway,3 Wheelers and most importantly assuming the people of the future will care a lot more about the environment and all the people who are going alone in a 5 seater car would have a option of sharing there carbon footprint left by the vehicle.And if the co-ordinates of the person with the car and the co-ordinates of the Person who is using the app matches then a Random Unique (one time use)Number or Picture or Anything which would be visible from atleast 10 feet away on a Min 6 inch screen.However this interface can be avoided by tracking the dots on the GPS system or by sending a snap shot of the car number or a photo of the person himself which will be destroyed automatically by the system once the person is down from the Vehicle.Punch Line Before I get to the main gates of the apartment.I should have the list of Vehicles available to me and the time it would take the vehicle to reach my place based on GPS and traffic conditions and also how much time would it take to reach my destination again based on real time traffic conditions and also most importantly.if i take  the public transport system.How much time would it take to reach the same destination and also how much Carbon foot print would i save from doing it.And also the time required by the vehicle to reach the local transport systems if it is not a walkable distance.There are many more ,But i think that is enough for the day.

GIVE THE CUSTOMER ALL THE POSSIBLE OPTIONS OF COMMUTING WITH THE CARBON FOOTPRINT AND THE COST AND THE TIME INVOLVED IRRESPECTIVE OF THE VENDOR OR GOVERNMENT SYSTEMS...

I have seen a lot on the news lately about 'self-driving' cars, and I think it would be neat if this technology could someday be applied to public transportation. I think 'self driving' buses would be an excellent mode of transportation. I think this would be particularly useful for smaller cities or towns that can't afford to have subway systems. Self driving buses could be programmed to stop at every stop timely and efficiently and could save the city money by eliminating the need to hire drivers and would cut out the issue of human error when it comes to being on time, not showing up for work, or causing accidents.

I imagine a series of widening arches or loops of roadway and of several different sizes to accompany different types of pubic transport. Cars wouldn't be allowed in the city but stored at various exit point garages which would be provided by the city. Small roads would have small shuttles, large roads would have large fast moving shuttles that span the city. Independently, smaller walkways would be used for pedestrians and cyclists (and other man powered or tiny engine machines.) Larger walkways could become festival street fair type roads that are common in places like Greece.

I imagine a type of highway for bicycles where people can use on and off ramps easily to reach their destination. They wont have to worry about cars since its a bike only highway system. it will get people to their destination quicker since they dont have to stop at traffic lights and watch out for pedestrians.

I imagine a type of hybrid car/rail system that are not owned by individuals.  A person would schedule a pickup to go to work and one home.  The cars would keep circulating picking up and dropping off people all day.  There would be much lesser need for personal parking as well.
I imagine that instead of transporting with cars we could turn all the roads in our neighborhood into rivers and use boats to get to places.

I live in a chicago suburb and I believe that driverless cars are the future.  But what I actually prefer is everyone driving their own vehicle, what i actually hope happens in the future is that licenses are much harder to get...there are so many people out there with no clue of the rules of the road and it is hazardous to everyone around them.

I live in a neighborhood near an excellent metro system, but not walkable to it. I would like a people-mover sort of system that travels through the neighborhood making the existing metro station more accessible. Perhaps small cars or pods at the end of each street that travel along an elevated rail directly to the metro station.
I live in a rural area so horseback travel, hay wagon travel and buckboard travel may well be decent substitutes for cars and buses presently being used.

I live in a rural community about 1 hour from a city. I would like to see this area build a light rail commuter line that could link these isolated communities and boost the economy. Many people out here do not even have cars.

I live in a small village.  Everything is close together, so it might be possible to have a bicycle share program.  Bicycles could be borrowed and then returned to the same place or a different place.  This would allow people to get around without using cars.
I live in a snowy climate, so there are a lot of times that we can't drive our cars anywhere because of all the snow. So a snowmobile taxi might work.

I live in a very hilly neighborhood. I suggest a funicular! A funicular is a railway built on a steep hill with tram cars for transport. Put it on one of the hills in the center of the neighborhood. People would be only a short walk (less than 10 minutes), hop on the funicular and it could take them to the church, the school and the neighborhood business district. Bam. No more worrying about going up and down the crazy hills, especially in the winter. Booyah!
I live in an area where horses are abundant. It would be a trip if everyone started using their horse instead of a car or motorcycle.

i live in twin falls idaho and we could use a bus line, i guess it isn't a new idea  but yeah this is a place where there is sharp economic divide and all the businesses are on the rich side of town, the original town or the poor side of town "old town" is roughly a mile from the main drag so buses would be great for people who cant afford cars and better for the environment in general

I live near the water, so water transportation would be nice to have. It could be a system of ferries that can go from port to port, carrying passengers like a bus system. This would reduce the amount of cars on the road and the amount of traffic.

I picture a brand new train system, going down the main street, with street cars going leading up to the main street.   I would love to see it being a high speed system, paying with your fingerprints.   It would be similar to a credit card.

I picture a streamlined 'box' like a cable car that is hanging from a line or track throughout the city. It would be shaped like a rectangle with smooth edges and very compact and sleak. It glides up to the booth where people may get on and each cable car 'box' can hold 6 people in 3 rows of 2 with a small walking aisle to the side.

I propose an idea that would rely on strong wire much like telephone wire that would be used to support a small train carriage like car or pod.  I see this as being better than a railway as it would be not as expensive to implement.

I see self driving cars for personal transportation. There will be several sizes available depending on the number of passengers. There will be cars for a single passenger and buses for large groups. You will pay by mile as well as a monthly fee to access the service. Almost all deliveries will be performed by drone. The postal service itself will begin to implement this delivery method on some routes. There will be specific roadways built to accommodate these new vehicles and special lanes, much like a carpool lane, that are available to only automated transports. Traffic, pollution and accidents will decrease sharply and it will be difficult to even obtain a license for a private vehicle although not impossible. This will largely be in place at the turn of the next century but some will be in service sooner.

I see the potential for self-driving cars to replace taxi services. People would call an automated line, or perhaps interact with a site/app on their computers/phones, to schedule to be picked up by the service. Meanwhile, a network that keeps track of all self-driving cars in its region would figure out which car was closest or would have to deviate the least to pick up the passenger within 5-10 minutes of being hailed. These cars could be compartmentalized to hold four or six passengers without individuals having to worry about undesired contact with the other passengers. The cars could run on electricity and the network would consider battery life with regards to planning routes and destinations.

I think a good idea will be to use electric cycles instead of a bike or a car in metros. They not only help in decreasing pollution as well as motivating people towards physical exercises.



A proper network of e cycles and connected to a main frame can be seen as a new transportation system emerging. Moreover this can also be used as a public transportation system by constructing cycle stands where they can be charged and the cost of public transport can be paid in the machine.
