I have recently returned a small-to-mid-sized city (60,000+ people, down from over 125,000 at its peak) after 20 years, and the public transportation system here is non-existent, Uber does not exist here (the nearest key city of 250,000+ people is 40 miles away), and there are 2 very small taxi companies which are not cost-effective or nearby enough to be efficient to use. In a situation like this, any alternative transportation would be beneficial, as this is a city where without a car/traditional vehicle, your ability to get even basic errands accomplished is compromised greatly. The city cited low ridership and rising fuel costs to keep the giant, hulking city buses operating as the reason for cancelling the public routes. My proposal would be to have smaller, and highly fuel-efficient modified Sprinter vans, each serving one small portion of the community, and running a smaller amount of the fleet during off-peak hours. This would allow the most economical and efficient model for the community to have access to needed transportation.

I have seen a lot on the news lately about 'self-driving' cars, and I think it would be neat if this technology could someday be applied to public transportation. Self driving buses could be programmed to stop at every stop timely and efficiently and could save the city money by eliminating the need to hire drivers and would cut out the issue of human error when it comes to being on time, not showing up for work, or causing accidents.

This idea would have to be built in a city near a river, or attached to a solar farm because it relies on using naturally produced hydroelectric or solar power. If you rode it long enough, you'd wind up at the same stop you got on at.  It relies completely on green energy, no exhaust just some electric motors driving the cars. People would be able to get on and just ride to where they needed to get off, leaving their personal vehicle in a parking area. a bus that plays all 80s music all the time

A great mode of transportation in my neighborhood could be a bus or tram that runs along the local parkway (a road that basically goes across the whole town) people would be able to hop on it and ride it to their destination and be there within walking distance when getting off the bus/tram. Could be relatively cheap, clear up traffic with less people having to drive around, and is highly economical.

I think it would be great to have a jitney-type bus that you could hail like a cab directly from the street.  The jitney would be electric powered and follow a specific route.  I think this would be great because I live in a town that has many tourists, but does not have a large population.  It could shuttle tourists to different areas, but the tourists wouldn't have to worry about a specific bus schedule.  The jitney could drive on streets that are not bus-accessible (some of our streets are "old world" and very narrow). There is also some frustration in my town about not having a vibrant night life because of lack of public transportation.  This jitney would allow people to go downtown, especially college students, and have some drinks without worrying about driving.  One of the stops would be the college campus. The jitney would have a very low fair to encourage people not to drink and drive.  This jitney would help downtown businesses and restaurants.

My small rural town doesn't even have an intact bus system, so anything would be better than it is now. But I would like a service that has people who drive pick up trucks to help you move things. For instance, if you go to the store and purchase a new couch, I'd like to have something like Uber for Pick Up Trucks to call and have them bring my sofa home so that I don't have to pay for outragious delivery fees from the store.
Sleeper buses that pick you up after a night of drinking, and take you to your workplace in the morning, which include showers.

Something like Uber or Lyft, but for getting kids to school. This way it's on an as needed basis rather than paying a flat fee for bus service that may not always be used for one reason or another. Especially when the child is staying late for practice or what not.

-a gondola system like at a ski resort

A new system of transporation in my neighborhood that I would really enjoy is high speed trains that could get you from one part of the city to  another in 5 minutes. A new transportation method could be using self driving vehicles. With self driving vehicles, you can let the robot do the critical thinking for you to ensure your safe arrival to your friendly neighborhood bar. This would be fun and convenient. This would also reduce the amount of wrecks on a friday and saturday night.
A new transportation system  can be something somewhat like a train, but a small train like shuttle, which can take others around the neighborhood, easy, fast and no traffic.

A new transportation system for my neighborhood would be a uber-like bus service. Buses have specific routes, and can stop at any point on that route if you use the service. That way you can have one pick you up close to your house instead of having to drop your car off at a bus station.

A new transportation system for our neighborhood could be shared scooters.  The scooters would be open for all to use and stocked at locations around the neighborhood.  You could check them out and return them for less money than the cost of a scooter.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood could be the use of drones to fly individuals in and around town, or to far off destinations. A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be rentable bicycle stations! They would be scattered all over the city. The racks would also have hand sanitizers and wipes so you could wipe down the public bikes before using them.  This would greatly reduce gas and emissions in the city and people would get good exercise biking around!

A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be similar to a train line, just on a smaller scale. The new system would have comfortable couch like chairs and be far more acceptable than the current forms of trnasportation availabe.

A new trolley system with free transportation would be beneficial since the neighborhood isn't very big and it would do well for people who could be handicap. I think the new trolley system could be hybrid -- electric and gas -- which most trolleys aren't.

A new way to transport in my neighborhood? I would honestly say cabs. They are not around where I live. But a cheaper way and only in the city. It's mostly just busses and the stops are few and far between.

A pedi cab service similar to Uber. People would sign up to drive people around on their bicycles. It's a small neighborhood and could easily be done. The call service could have a phone app and website to make it easier to schedule pick ups.

A rail that goes back and forth from campus with known arrival times would be ideal for students to travel from campus to their homes and neighborhoods. This would be like a miniature above ground subway.
A skateboard tram that runs on a track through the neighborhood to the local bus stops

A solar-powered trolley system that works like an automated bus, mixed with a roller coaster. A system of neighborhood drivers who form a cooperative and use their own vehicles to provide transportation services. We live in a community of 1875 people in a rural area, it may not be practical, but it is doable.

A system where there are rails above you and nothing underneath you.

You sit in a cart of sorts and you are guided along near the streets, maybe above the streets or sidewalk.

The railings connect overhead and end at each sidewalk and gives you a nice view of the neighborhood, kind of like a ski-lift.
A trolley would be awesome in my small neighborhood since it already has a decent grid of streets
a vehicle that goes around the neighborhood and offers free homework help for kids.

An alternate transportation system in my neighborhood would be a free transportation system that can take you anywhere that you like. Paying for transportation is not easy since everybody carries debit or credit cards nowadays. Hardly anybody has change or cash on them. Free transportation would be great, and it should be something other than a bus. It should just be a regular vehicle as well with a friendly driver to take you somewhere.

An alternative transportation system in my neighborhood could involve something such as a taxi like service but one that ran kind of like a bus, involving general cars. These services could flow around the city and offer rides to people who may not be able to afford any other type of transportation.

An electric monorail with a few cars that travel between the shopping center about a mile a way from us through the little downtown and stopping at the regional rail station a mile the other direction from us. It would have 2 or 3 trains that run back and forth all day and night transporting people between those two major zones in our neighborhood, eliminating the need for cars to travel nearby.

An extensive network of electric vehicles that run off solar power. They sit out in the sun all day anyway, and can be shared and used as needed by the neighborhood. The neighborhood pays a monthly maintenance fee to use the vehicles. They may be used for shorter city trips.

An idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood would be to use cars with automated driving that would allow the person(s) to input the destination and go about doing other things while the car drove itself to that location.

An idea I've had is the concept of personal golf carts that are used in malls, country clubs and campuses but having a few of these carts that use alternative energy methods like charging or solar power. 



They would be small and won't go at very high speeds but they could be useful for getting people in the neighborhood around for errands or nearby places while saving them money on gas and helping the environment somewhat.



It could be a small fleet the neighborhood keeps around and they are rented out to the local community for a small fee or monthly payment.

An underground network system in the neighborhood, like a subway but only bikes and small motorcycles can travel through. This will be a good way to protect against the weather and steer clear of any incoming cars.

Atlanta could have a much, much wider public transportation system. The subway would go to many different neighborhoods, extending in different directions instead of being a simple cross. Much more attention will be given to cyclist and pedestrian safety, with enforced ticketing for drivers that ignore traffic laws along with more bike lanes and pedestrian crossings.

autonomous vehicles abound. there are shared autonomous vehicles that can be called by neighborhood members. you may travel to destinations within your town only. the cost is shared by real estate tax. the benefit is a drastic reduction in traffic congestion, as much fewer cars are needed.
Can use a taxi hailing service in my neighborhood to get from one point to another. It is relies on a service car and workers.

carpooling, so many in our neighborhood go to the same places.  We could develop an app to see who can carpool with who .. state where, when you are going somewhere and people can sign up.. if they can drive or can pay for gas

Currently, I live in a small town that has a public transportation system. I propose a busing system that's like the one in bigger cities for my neighborhood. Developing a bike path throughout the neighborhood that goes directly to business locations would encourage more people to ride bikes and drive their cars less.  This bike path could snake all around the city with entries directly to all business locations making it an easy option for people.
Disperse grocery stores closer to neighborhoods, to avoid long trips to buy milk
Driverless cars, it's the only thing I can imagine being different in my neighborhood.  We do not have room for new rail systems.

Each neighborhood gets together to say what time they will be leaving that has a automatic system that will call and tell everyone in the neighborhood or in short distance where they are going and when they are leaving. It could be like a carpool system where everywhere you go it will auto call if that person is gong to another location and you still have room in your vehicle.

A real help would be a circulator bus system for the neighborhoods surrounding our subway station. For transportation in my neighborhood we have cars, and buses. The most popular mode of transportation being the four door family sedan type car. I live in a small town so I think the future transportation system in my neighborhood will be to get rid of normal sized roads and create bike and walking paths all over town. I live in a very hilly neighborhood. I suggest a funicular! A funicular is a railway built on a steep hill with tram cars for transport. Put it on one of the hills in the center of the neighborhood. No more worrying about going up and down the crazy hills, especially in the winter. Booyah!

I think a bullet train would be very useful. A train that can transport passengers fast in between the major areas in the neighborhood, for example to schools, the downtown area, the performing arts theater, shopping districts, the airport etc. It doesn't have to stop very often like a bus but an instead be used for getting between major areas and can be supported by the bus system.

I think a drone transport system that would carry people, good and other items would be a great service.  An even better idea is if was peer run, meaning run by people in your neighborhood, and all the profits would be split.

I think a great idea for a transportation system would be a neighborhood or city that bans cars and uses all bikes to get around. I think a great idea within my neighborhood would basically to have a moving sidewalk like you would find at an airport.  This would allow people to move about faster than maybe they would walking, so people wouldn't feel the need to get in the car to go down the block to the store.

I think a new transportation that utilizes a type of rail system on the sidewalks that people can easily easily walk throughout the neighborhood - similar to the moving walkways at airports.  Sort of like a conveyor belt for people.

I think my neighborhood would benefit from one of those pedal bike bars for the downtown area. There is a lot of history and what better way to enjoy it than while sipping a nice drink and getting some exercise

I think that a trolly system would work well in phoenix.  They would run frequently, be smaller than a bus and go into more neighborhoods.

I think that some sort of charging commuter car should be parked in every neighborhood. People could coordinate commute times and use electric cars instead of gas, in exchange they pay $1 a day to drive the car per person.

I wish my neighborhood had a giant conveyor belt for going to all the main places downtown.  It would help the older people as well be convenient.  It would have to be waterproof and covered.  It could run all along the one side of the main intersections without ever having to cross.
I would enjoy having a limousine service in the neighborhood. That would be a safe and comfortable mode of transportation.

I would imagine a monorail type of situation.  With frequent stops around the neighborhood so everyone was able to get on relatively near their home.  It would move quickly and make stops at the nearby schools and stores.

I would like a city trolley. The trolley would travel around the city several times a day, taking and picking up residents from the major shopping areas. The trolley stops should be no more than two blocks from any neighborhood.

I would like for a train to be in my neighborhood.   IT would go right down the sides of our main streets.   There is a train currently, but you have to drive far to it.   There should be more trains, not just one or two.

I would like to see a system of localized automated delivery. A system which is run as a utility for the town or city in which the focus is put on small businesses in the area. I think this could have hyper-local economic benefits, as it may help small businesses steal back sales from online marketplaces like Amazon. I see it being a motorized electric drone, that could use something like a bike lane to bring goods to local neighborhoods from small businesses in area.  it Could be coupled with a publicly run website for ordering and added revenues from ad placement on site and/or vehicles could help give money back to towns and cities.
I would like to see an expanded light rail system with more of a neighborhood connection.  Right now our light rail pretty much just connects the Downtown core with the airport.
I would like to see my city connected via a light rail system which would greatly reduce traffic and emissions.  I envision the majority of neighborhoods in the Downtown core being connected.

I would love for there to a more intergrated train system in my city (specifically my neighborhood.) I'd love to be able to hop on a train (or streetcar) and be able to transfer to a larger rail system that would take me to other cities, etc. Something like what european cities have.

I would love if my neighborhood had a rail system that worked from magnets and floated along the rail at high speeds.  I wish that the cars were individual and that I could get in and select from a list of destinations.  I would like my own car and to be able to bring my dogs with me.  It would be fast and smooth and work with minimal power.

I'd like to see some kind of motorcycle rental system in my neighborhood. This would be really convienant and I imagine quite affordable as well. I live in a high tourism area as well and I think this would be more fun for people to explore the city than renting traditional cars.

I'd like to see the railroad tracks by our house be repurposed as a walking and biking route for the neighborhood.  It would be really sweet if they could use that and carry the corridor all the way to the nearest town and shopping area.
If we had taxis in our neighborhood had a rewards card program where you can earn free rides.
Imagine streets that are great for bicycling, walking, taking transit and just for enjoying in our neighborhood
In many neighborhoods, stop signs are ignored. I believe switching to yield signs, where ideally suitable, is needed and adding 'bus stops' for local schools that do not hinder traffic.
In my neighborhood i imagine a trolley on solar powered magnetic train tracks. This keeps the trolley moving at all times but keeps anyone from getting hurt like children.

In my neighborhood I think the best type of transportation system would be an elevated railway like a tram at disney world it would make commuting between neighboring cities far easier and the technology would make commutes more timely.
In my neighborhood it would be like a monorail system. Something that you could get on at one stop and take it to another are you would want to go. Connecting locations you would visit.

In my neighborhood, any kind of public transportation would be innovative. Due to the apparent stigma of such, I would propose a lovely electric-run "uber coach" instead of the big ugly city bus. This could be as simple as a mini-van and could deliver us suffering commuters of Southern California from a few select and regular pick-up spots to bigger, car-pool mega spots at various freeway points.
In my neighborhood, any public transportation would  be new. We could make rentable bicycles that are in a convenient location
In my neighborhood, I would like to see some sort of updated streetcar system with solar panels on the top of the street cats,, some sort of energy capture technology on the tracks.
In my neighborhood, there's not a lot of space, so I'd have to go with covered bikes of some sort, or one of those neat bike trollys. That would be a neat way to get around and exercise.

Instead of paving trucks coming through the neighborhoods, laying down new asphalt, it would be soap trucks.  The streets would be lined with giant tarps, and people would slip and slide to their destinations on specially crafted slip and sliders.  They would look sort of like a canoe, but with a flat bottom.  I think underneath the tarp, there would be air pockets that sensed whenever an object passed over them.  Whenever an object passes over the air pockets, they rapidly self inflate, thereby pushing the slip and slide canoe further and faster.

It would be a free system (every family in the neighborhood would have to contribute $300-$400 as a one time fee). Then the bus would run through the neighborhood every hour and take you to anywhere in the neighborhood that you need to go! You would be able to text the driver before hand of where you are going.

It would be an electric tram that would ride in the center turning lane of my neighborhood.  It would look like a two-car train that would seat around 40 people.  It would make frequent stops at major intersections and shopping centers in the neighborhood by pulling off to the side in the bike lane. It would have solar panels on the top to help off-set the electricity use.

It would be an underground bullet train system that connected major hubs around the city. It would take only minutes to get from one station to the other across town. There would be train systems at each neighborhood of the city, and you could get on an off at any stop in the underground tunnel.You would pay with a chip card so that you wouldn't need to carry cash or change. The bullet trains would be large capacity so that overcrowding of buses would be a thing of the past.
It would be cool it we had a monorail type system throughout the neighborhood that does a simple circle and takes kids or adults from the neighboorhood into the town/school area.

It would be effective to create a bike club in my neighborhood.  We would choose at least 1 day a week to ride our bikes to work decreasing neighborhood traffic and air pollution.  This bike club would host meetings once a month and reward people who rode the most days to work that month incentivizing people to ride more often.

It would be great if we had raised, walkable paths all throughout my neighborhood. They would be similar to bridges, only not as high and not as wide, that way people could walk or run for exercise and not worry about being struck by vehicles.

It would be great to have a bike share program in my neighborhood. Just have a couple bike lock stations and have the city get us a bunch of bikes, and just use the bikes as we need them and park then when we're done.

It would be hard to have a viable system in my neighborhood, because this area is so scattered. I think the best idea would be a bikeshare; inexpensive access to bikes would be a great idea! The bigger issue would be making our area bike-friendly. That's the part the requires creativity. We could add extra lanes and then add over/underpasses at intersections to make bikes not just inexpensive, but even more time-effective than driving.

It would be like a super fast tram or train so the people in my neighborhood could get to run errands without their cars. We could have stops at the entrances to the neighborhood and the tracks could just run down the street.

It would be small individual electric golf cart-like cars that run along the edge of the sidewalks every couple of minutes that people can hop into to go to the grocery store, pharmacy, post office, etc.  they operate from out of a common neighborhood "hub" so each system covers a small area.  People can just call one from an app on their smart phone, they are charged a small fee, then after the trip, the cart remains in one area until it is called again or it returns to the hub to be charged.

It's a small town. In and near the town center there will be bike lanes and you will be able to access all neighborhoods in an easy and safe manner. There will be bike rental kiosks throughout the area. For areas outside town there could be a service with electric vehicles that you can book ahead of time and you can catch a ride to select locations around town.
Kind of a monorail system that goes from stops in neighborhoods and takes people to a stop near the stores, etc.  Open top with a cover, no need to heat or cool, wouldn't run in extreme weather.
Light rail connecting outer neighborhoods to the city would be good for everyone for jobs and business.

Maybe a neighborhood car service where people pitch in a certain amount per month, and then they can order a car to drive them anywhere in the neighborhood that they need to go to

Maybe a service where high school students (age 16 and up) who have their license could opt to take an hour out of the school day to drive people around in the neighborhood (who need a ride) and the people would pay a discounted rate.

Maybe for anyone who has a driver's license, and needs extra money, there could be a service that is kind of like an Uber but it serves a neighborhood specifically. And the drivers would be people in the neighborhood who need extra money, and want to do part time work (on an as needed basis.)

Maybe for college students who need college credit, their neighborhood could set up a "class" that meets twice a week for an hour each, and the licensed student could drive whoever around who needs it. And they could receive college credit for it!
Maybe like a neighborhood taxi that would be assigned to a specific neighborhood, and would circulate and pick up people at a discounted rate!
maybe to save money, for rides throughout the neighborhood, it could just be a horse and carriage. someone could donate a few horses, and a few carriages, and everything would be for free
Mini bus services around the neighborhood covering the residential area so that single rides can be reduced
Moving bench that is connected to tracks to help older people travel short distances within their neighborhoods.

Moving platforms that function like traincars and moving sidewalks put together. They would go above roads, have railings on each side and be like busses with bus stops. You could buy a thing like a bus pass that allows you x number of rides, so that you don't have to have cash on your person to be able to get on it. It would run from neighborhoods to main city areas and only be running when people call for it/use it to save money on electricity/gas/whatever

My idea alternative transportation in the neighborhood would be horseback. There would be nice safe wide equestrian trails throughout allowing you to visit neighbors, go to the convenience or grocery store which would have hitching posts. Motorized vehicles would be limited to passenger cars/trucks.

My idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood is a series of really big tubes, with padding, and occasionally air holes, with mesh filters to prevent bugs and large debris from getting in.  The tubes would be places alongside all the streets, and be at a constant forward vacuum, with enough lessening of suction to allow people to grasp a handle at their stop and get out.   (If you miss your stop, you just ride around until it comes up again, pushing yourself towards the right tube as it comes towards you.)



Collision between travelers would need to be solved, as well as how to clean up any errant body fluids left by travelers; perhaps a daily purge at midnight, where the suction could be increased exponentially and all materials dumped in a pile, on a rotating schedule, on different people's lawns.   



This system has the benefit of a very low carbon footprint, and lends itself well to spontaneous exclamations of 'cowabunga'.  



Implementation note: This idea may require anti-gravity research, in addition to a lot of suction.
My idea is re-creating the Trolly car, they would go through neighborhoods and people can hop on and off as it slowly moves.

My idea would be to use a moving belt (like used in airport terminals) instead of sidewalks to get around my neighborhood. I live is a small town (population about 500), so it would encourage people to drive less to get to destinations that are close to their homes.

My neighborhood added an above ground train similar to the "L" in Chicago.  It runs along the highways bringing people downtown from the suburbs.  It does a few loops downtown and runs near the major companies to get people to work.  It is much cheaper and more convenient than driving downtown and parking.
My neighborhood currently has no bike lanes, so I would imagine a system with renewable transportation integrated into the layout. Spaces for bikes, electric car re-charging stations, etc.

My neighborhood filled with uber drives. However, there is no cost assoicated with the transit it is all provided by the town. It would be like new york city (think of cabs), however nice black cars everywhere and someone can hop in to any one they want free of charge. Baisically be like public transit with uber and they will take you wherever you want.

my neighborhood future transportation system will be made up of flying cars. This cars will be able to take off and land like helicopters. There will be no more traffic jams, traffic light, annoying speed limits and harassing cops. People will be able to travel to any part of the world without going through airports and flight connections. There will be new telecommunication and navigation technology that will help the drivers navigate safely without having mid air collisions and also mid air gas stations to refuel the cars.

My neighborhood has little walk-ability due to poor road quality and an abundance of speed bumps. My Idea is simple in that they can add multiple lanes above the street for bikes and people walking. This would be on par with what cities have over major crossings but will cost relatively little money compared with adding a train or increasing the once daily buses. This would also allow any expansion of the roads under the walkways and reduce the 10 or so deaths a year from cars hitting people when they are just walking on the side of the road.
My neighborhood has no transportation system. So a simple bus would help.

There would be a whole network of pod so you could go all over town.  It will also be overhead, like over the sidewalks and bike paths.
My neighborhood needs a car share system between individuals. It would be similar to Uber but you would be able to drive someone else's car for a monthly fee.
My neighborhood will continue to use mainly personal vehicles as a mode of transportation, though the downtown area is working on an underground rail system.

Not just in my neighborhood but metro-wide, my city recently established time share bicycles people can rent and ride when they have a short distance to travel. The bikes are all of the same design, having a large sturdy frame painted light blue, three gears (the gear box is inside the rear wheel axle, and LED blinker lights for safety. Necessarily, it's a one-size-fits-all arrangement; there's no way to raise or lower the seat unless you carry your own tools around with you, so if you're a tall person and use one of these bikes you'll be knocking yourself in the chin with your knees.
peer to peer sharing of vehicles within a neighborhood. there is accountability with keeping the vehicles clean since it is shared within a community.

Segway rental stations placed all over the neighborhood.  Just rent out a segway for a given amount of time and return it to the nearest station when finished with use.  Segways are relatively low profile and can easily be used by most people.

The future transportation system in me neighborhood is going to consist of driverless vehicles that hover and travel with the help of magnetism. On the other hand, if people want to own their own vehicle then it is possible. They can travel where ever they want to and all they have to do is to recharge their solar battery in the sunlight.

The future transportation system in my neighborhood is called air cars. They were created in an effort to reduce carbon footprints and try to save our planet. These vehicles are much more lighter than regular cars and can be upgraded to fly. The best thing about these cars is that they operate solely on air. This is our last ditch effort to save the Earth, so buy a Clean Car.

The future transportation system in my neighborhood would possibly incorporate traffic light systems that would detect the amount of traffic and flow to better keep traffic moving and prevent long lines and wait times at intersections therefor reducing trip times and automobile emissions.

The neighborhood needs a rail system that runs adjacent to the highway. This would go from major city to major city with the same stops as for those that drive.

The new transportation in my neighborhood is by teleportation! There will be a number of discs on the floor, coated in white paint, that people will step on and be teleported to wherever they would like to be. There is a catch - you have to do jumping jacks to get the teleporter started!

The new transportation is a light rail that also includes trolley service for my neighborhood and city. For $1.00 each way, the light rail runs from east to west and from north to south. The light rail takes you to all major events in the city and portion of all fares go to pay for school resources in the community.
The transportation system in my neighborhood consists of each person driving their own cars. Occasionally, people will carpool, but there is no public transportation and walking is not feasable.

This is about car pooling. As our residences are located far away from our work place, we, in our neighborhood have passed a resolution that to share our sitting in our cars (each a day in a week) to reduce pollution, save money, etc. and it works good too. :-)

There will just be an overhead system running the lengths of the sidewalks at 7 foot high so no one gets hurt if they fall.
underground subway that extends to all major neighborhoods. It would be fast and convenient to use.

what is needed is a tubular powered zipline based transportation system. a combination of pnewumatic and electric power will propel people from place to place in a similar manner to a ski lift except it would just be a small tube that has a chain of sorts running in it along the sidewalks. all you would have to do is to have a harness on and when you need to go to one of the destinations you hook on to the line that is color coded for your destination and cruise on down there. When I imagine future transportation in my neighborhood I visualize the vehicles of today with more advanced technology. A great mode of transportation in my neighborhood could be a bus or tram that runs along the local parkway (a road that basically goes across the whole town) people would be able to hop on it and ride it to their destination and be there within walking distance when getting off the bus/tram. A bunch of self driving cars that will replace buses and taxis. The will have free wifi and be very cheap.

A electric scooter sharing program for getting around town without having to drive a car and use too much gas or take up too much space.

A fare based system would allow heavy car users to pay more and light ones to pay less for gas, tolls, etc.  Their car will have a gps tracker to see where and when they go (downtown, rush hour, etc.)  This will help the people who don't need to drive as much and tax the ones that are always on the road.

A fleet of cheap, reliable, automated taxi cars. The cars would drive automatically after an input was made for the destination. These cars would be self charging with paint that has solar energy potential.

Enter an app that connects you to people along your travel rout who also need to go into town. You could flag yourself as offering a ride or needing a ride.

A network of publicly available electric cars will drive around the city in the most efficient manner possible. People will use apps to call a car to get them =from one of many pickup spots and drop them off before they go on the next passenger.

A new carpool system. You get together with a group of people at a park and ride. Park your car there and commute in a van with a group of people to work. This save gas and some of you can nap while the other is driving.

A new transportation method could be using self driving vehicles. A new transportation system.... Self driving cars/ trolleys (absolutely no tracks or special lanes for the trolley just self driving)
a new type of rail system with certain drop off points, but the rail system is above the road so it doesnt interfere with people driving cars.

A public transport system with self-driving cars. You go online, select your destination and then order a self driving car to pick you up.

A rail cart, that is powered by friction and capturing the head it produces while being driven down the rail, it starts with a simple pedal of a bike to create enough momentum and friction to start the process going and then as soon as you produce enough energy to get it moving, it will continue to produce and move forward till you press the brakes. BAM!
A rail system that is build from the ground up. This would be capable of high speeds typically not able to travel when driving or on another train. This would make work transit much faster.

A Railway system for cars, like something out of minority report. You can still drive on the roads but the speed limit is controlled and there is never any accidents because you input your destination into a program in the individual cars and let the railway system get you there.
A self driving lawn mower.  Use the technology for self driving cars to create a self driving lawn mower.

A social platform similar to facebook related to all things travel. People would be able to connect with others and find people traveling the same route. If 3 riders, each pay 1/3.. 4 riders pay 1/4, etc.

A system could allow cars to drive up to a rail station and be loaded onto a platform. It could be optional to have the driver stay inside for short trips or get out for longer trips. The platforms could then allow cars to be quickly transported along rail lines instead of having to consume fuel. These can be used on older less used rail tracks, making use of existing infrastructure and help clear traffic along busy highways.
A system of fast moving conveyor belts that help move people quickly instead of walking and driving short distances.

A tax write-off for driving strangers to work.  This way, the stranger doesn't have to pay for the ride, the person driving still gets ample benefit for dropping someone off on the way to their job and the like.  There could be a little schedule online you fill out saying where you're going, and at what time.  



People who are interested in being helpful can go to this site, find out whats on their way, and scoop up the people.  Think uber, but instead of money, just get a dollar or two back on your taxes for every single person you pick up.



You'd be able to rate the drivers, and in order for them to be eligible for the write off, they'd need to maintain a high rating.  If anyone abuses it, or misses picking people up, they are barred from using it for a few months.
A taxi service where self-driving cars can be dispatched to a client which then drive the client to their destination and then return to HQ.

An app that worked somewhat like Uber, but is for ride-sharing/car pooling.  You put in your destination, whether you can drive or not, what time you need to be to your destination, and an acceptable range for the location.  The app would look for others with similar destinations or destinations en-route for others as well as the best route to minimize drive time, but maximize people getting to their destination.  Then the app would calculate a fair percentage of the ride cost for each person based on their destination, travel distance, etc.  Public transportation here isn't great because we are so spread out.  After each ride you could rate other passengers and the driver and those ratings could be used to filter out bad users entirely or just below a certain rating level.

An automated system of cabs. Not cars though, more like carriages driven by AI "Horses" (Imagine that new Harley electric motorcycle engine, in a short, small, bullet shaped car like you used to see on the SIDE of a motorcycle, pulling a carriage, with an AI brain controlling it). A system like this would have the novelty and functionality of pulling people when you wanted to, or you could just use the AI 'sidecar' to run courier errands on the ground for companies that wanted fast delivery. Think like Amazon drones without the flying, the noise or the whole 'being small enough to get shot down by a .22 and stolen' thing. It keeps the battery away from the passengers if there is ever a crash, too. Which is good because those things can explode sometimes. The best thing about it, though? When it's just moving small items around for parcel delivery, it's not wasting fuel hauling an empty cab around with it. I can't stand seeing people waste so much energy driving a giant SUV around with no passengers or cargo. That act alone should be a top priority for politicians pushing for environmental reform to be talking about.

An autonomous car service. This would require the building and investing into self driving cars. You would have a mobile app you can call and request a car and one is immediately dispatched to you. Using your phone you tell it where you want to go. It navigates there. Best of all, this would be free - or very cheap.

An idea for a new transportation system in my neighborhood would be to use cars with automated driving that would allow the person(s) to input the destination and go about doing other things while the car drove itself to that location.

Self driveable cars that could provide a much better service than the often RUDE cab drivers could provide. Plus, I trust a robot way more than some of these morons driving!

carpooling, so many in our neighborhood go to the same places.  We could develop an app to see who can carpool with who .. state where, when you are going somewhere and people can sign up.. if they can drive or can pay for gas

Cars that can connect their GPS's so when they are all going to similar locations they can switch on auto drive and so all the computers can drive automatically. Once the closest stop comes around it'll make it so you have to drive the rest of the way.
Cars that can drive themselves, but people don't own them. They're a service provided by the city and you sign up for it and call when you need a car and the nearest one comes to you

Conveyor belts on the sidewalks, similar to the ones on the airports, wouldn't be a bad idea. This would be perfect if you live near lots of stores, like a grocery store, drug stores, post offices, shopping centers, etc. This will cut back on driving.

Every car would be able to hover or fly. Every car that runs off gasoline will be rare to find and all the cars have a feature that are able to drive themselves. Even motorcycles will be something that you find in a museum.

Everything runs on automated self driving cars.  Normal cars are not allowed on the road.  Everything will run smoothly since it is computer operated and parking spaces won't be needed.  Bicyclists will no longer have to worry.

Get some large vans and people who are going to the same general area to work can all ride together.  They take turns driving.  It'll be like kids' school buses but for adults.  It'll save money and help bond co-workers together.  There will be enough room for a lot of people so the chances of an incident are slim.  It'll also help when it's bad weather because some people are afraid to drive in it and this would ease some of that stress.  Plus, they could all share in the maintenance and gas for the bus/car so that could save them a lot of money.

Group carpools to work.  There could be an app that puts you in contact with people who work at the same company you work at or in close proximity to your work location.  The app would allow drivers to sign up to drive to work and with a rotating schedule this would cut down the amount of driving that any one single person would have to do.
Have a monorail system around town. It'll reduce pollution because people will have fun using it instead of driving their cars.

Have driverless cars available for instant calls.

Having cars that drive themselves come and pick you up and take you where you need to go
Hyperloop:  essentially a super fast subway in a pressurized tube like they use at the drive up to a bank to send things back and forth only on a scale large enough for people to ride in

I have seen a lot on the news lately about 'self-driving' cars, and I think it would be neat if this technology could someday be applied to public transportation. I think 'self driving' buses would be an excellent mode of transportation. I think this would be particularly useful for smaller cities or towns that can't afford to have subway systems. Self driving buses could be programmed to stop at every stop timely and efficiently and could save the city money by eliminating the need to hire drivers and would cut out the issue of human error when it comes to being on time, not showing up for work, or causing accidents.

I live in a chicago suburb and I believe that driverless cars are the future.  But what I actually prefer is everyone driving their own vehicle, what i actually hope happens in the future is that licenses are much harder to get...there are so many people out there with no clue of the rules of the road and it is hazardous to everyone around them.
I live in a snowy climate, so there are a lot of times that we can't drive our cars anywhere because of all the snow. So a snowmobile taxi might work.

I live in a town right on the ocean and there are many canals here. I think a canoe taxi service would be really convenient and fun. It wouldn't get people to their desired locations super fast but it would allow people to travel leisurely and enjoy the scenery along the way. It would also be really healthy for the people driving the canoes and help them to stay fit.

I live in a very rural area that doesn't get bus service because of low population. My idea would be a bus service that runs on the same premise as a taxi service... when someone in the area would need a ride, the bus would alter its route to pick up a passenger. That way, the remote area could be serviced by mass transit, yet wouldn't have to waste fuel or money driving to the remote area all of the time. These requests could be put in via phone, web portal, or e-mail.

I live on an army base. There are hundreds of vehicles that just sit around and collect rust, and it would be wonderful if the military could find some way to rent these vehicles out to the public. This would create income for individual units and help add to their budget, as well as providing vehicles to civilians who need them and even potentially drawing in interested persons who would otherwise never have driven a military vehicle.

I see a totally different way of transportation in the future. I see solar a powered tram replacing all the buses and since the cost is so much lower there will be many more of them so you can get anywhere you want to go anytime. In addition to the in city tram there will be a super high speed solar powered train that can go 150 mph or more! That will make it so what used to be a 2 hour drive or more will now be a short train ride away. For those who do not want to take the tram there will be an unmanned flying drone taxi. All you do it either tell it your destination or input the location yourself and it automatically takes you there.

I see self driving cars for personal transportation. There will be several sizes available depending on the number of passengers. There will be cars for a single passenger and buses for large groups. You will pay by mile as well as a monthly fee to access the service. Almost all deliveries will be performed by drone. The postal service itself will begin to implement this delivery method on some routes. There will be specific roadways built to accommodate these new vehicles and special lanes, much like a carpool lane, that are available to only automated transports. Traffic, pollution and accidents will decrease sharply and it will be difficult to even obtain a license for a private vehicle although not impossible. This will largely be in place at the turn of the next century but some will be in service sooner.

I think a method that would improve the transportation system would be to change how turn lanes are handled in America. Overseas, to turn left, you veer off to a lane on the right that comes to a stop so that you don't block traffic waiting to turn and then when it is clear, you drive across the street onto the road you were going to turn onto.

I think it would be great to have a jitney-type bus that you could hail like a cab directly from the street.  The jitney would be electric powered and follow a specific route.  I think this would be great because I live in a town that has many tourists, but does not have a large population.  It could shuttle tourists to different areas, but the tourists wouldn't have to worry about a specific bus schedule.  The jitney could drive on streets that are not bus-accessible (some of our streets are "old world" and very narrow). There is also some frustration in my town about not having a vibrant night life because of lack of public transportation.  This jitney would allow people to go downtown, especially college students, and have some drinks without worrying about driving.  One of the stops would be the college campus. The jitney would have a very low fair to encourage people not to drink and drive.  This jitney would help downtown businesses and restaurants.

I think teleportation would be awesome. Wouldn't need cars anymore, save on oil and fumes in the environment. People would be happier because they wouldn't be stuck in traffic or have to drive hours to see long distance family members.

I think that some sort of charging commuter car should be parked in every neighborhood. People could coordinate commute times and use electric cars instead of gas, in exchange they pay $1 a day to drive the car per person.
I think that there should be a way to get bugs off a windshield without harming the paint job on a car.  It should be a spray while you are driving much like windshield wiper fluid
I think there should be bikes that you can easily rent. You can get them in the major shopping areas and drive them around town to get excercise as well as helping to use less gasoline.

I wish we had a monorail between the airport and our city. We aren't connected to any public transportation system, but more than 70% of our residents travel by plane more than once a year. Many people travel for work, etc. Rather than each of us driving and paying to park our cars there, if we could stay in our suburb and take the monorail (or train) to and from it would save a great deal of money and time.

I would like for a train to be in my neighborhood.   IT would go right down the sides of our main streets.   There is a train currently, but you have to drive far to it.   There should be more trains, not just one or two.

I would like to see a short-term car rental service with semi-autonomous driving. For example, if I needed to go to the airport and didn't want to leave my current car in a parking lot their I could rent a car that I could summon with a smartphone app. The car would be able autonomously drive directly to me or a location I choose through the app. After I was at the location of my choosing and no longer needed the car, I could then use the app to send the car away.

I would like to see all self driving cars, driving at top speeds because human error and crashes have been removed from the equation. So everyone can get to their destination five, maybe ten times as fast, without a significant infrastructure overhaul.

I would like to see magnet-driven trains that would not only connect all the part of my very spread out city, but also could connect the major cities in the state together. Ideally, these would be largely automated, but with several emergency safety features, like an onboard override cabin and override booths at each station. There would also have to be a central monitoring hub to keep an eye on the system in general, that in the city would likely have to be run underground, but above ground tracks would be possible between most cities, allowing passengers to avoid traffic and enjoy the wonderful views at the same time. Magnetic drive and perhaps even levitation would help with getting passengers around in snow storms, which often disrupt traffic here in the winter.

I would love to see a social network for people that work for a certain business. This social network would allow you to find rides from other employees that live in your area. Every business would have an account at this website, and employees who want to pick up other employees can volunteer. Maybe a $5 fee per person each week to account for gas money, but it could be like it would tell you who lives within 10 miles from you that works where you do, and you can ride share or carpool with them. It would be almost like a social network where you can talk to other employees you don't know and then you can ride together or take turns driving.

I would love to see an Uber type of program but for doctor appointments. Where the doctor's office has drivers who are willing to pick up patients and drop them back off at home. Maybe like 1 person driving in a city and just bringing the patients to the doctor so that people won't have to drive to the doctor, especially older people.

I would love to see some kind of computer-operated taxi service in my city. The roads would be a lot safer of cars weren't being driven by humans, and I feel like people would be a lot more productive. I would love if I could just sit in the backseat and read or do work on my way to work, instead of having to pay attention to the road every second. It would also save money from having to buy a car if I could jsut call one of these taxis whenever I need to go somewhere.
I would really like to see separate lanes for scooters in my area.  A lot more people are commuting this way, and it would be good if it was a safer way to drive.

Perhaps you would subscribe to the service an at annual or monthly rate and be given a special kind of 'key' that would give access to any of the cars currently at the pick up location. It would be first come first serve, and there would be smart technology embedded in both the cars and the keys. In the interest of reducing traffic and accidents, a new series of self-driving only roads and lanes are opened.  On these roads, ONLY self driving cars are authorized to drive, and on them there are no speed limits (not that the self-driving cars would be going that much faster than normal). Unfettered by the chaos of common roads and the limitations of human judgement, these exclusively self-driving vehicle areas allow the navigational AIs to coordinate for an optimally fast and efficient journey.

Moving sidewalks all over the city would be amazing. People could hop on and even sit and get to their destination.  They'd be like the ones in airports, but they would go faster.  Some could even run into and through tubes so people would be protected in bad weather.  Something like a gerbil habitat would be amazing.  I think it would promote people walking instead of driving.  Or, just standing on the moving sidewalks.  It would reduce pollution if people took things like this around the city.

My idea is a combination of self driving cars, rideshare and a train. Commuters would pay for a ticket and a line of connected self driving cars would take commuters going the same route/direction to a certain dropoff point, like a train does. Then when the string of cars reaches the stop point, each passenger can enter their desired destination into the touchpad screen in the car and they would be driven to their individual destinations. The self driving cars would break off individually from the train to take these passengers, then they'd return on their own to the "train station" to go pick up more passengers.

My idea is of a drive-on subway. Just like cars can be driven onto ferries, where a person can stay in there car while the ferry transports them across the water and then drive off the ferry onto land again once the ferry has reached its destination, drive-on subways would allow something similar. Certain stops would not be for people boarding, but for cars. The cars would go into specialized compartments and the drivers would be required to stay in their vehicles so as not to cause any danger. The cars would be allowed to drive off of the subway vehicle at certain stops too. This way, people could be using both the subway system and their cars at the same time, so they end up with the benefits of both! The subway can take them somewhere along its route, and their car can take them the rest of the way where the subway doesn't go. It would cut down on traffic and probably encourage people to take the subway even when they're not using their car. A lot of people are hesitant to try public transit, but once they try it, they find it efficient, so this would really show people how efficient it can be. 

While on board the subway, the people in cars would see lights in their compartment, just like a stoplight, telling them when it is okay to drive off. The doors would automatically open at every stop where cars are allowed to exit, and then a green light would go on that the driver could easily see, so they'd know it's their time to drive off. When it turns to yellow, it means the doors are closing soon, so the driver should either hurry up or choose to stay on. Of course, the doors would have motion-sensors so they wouldn't close on a car either way. There would also be maps inside each compartment with cars showing where the stops are, so a driver can prepare for where they need to get off at.

My idea is to build an app for uber drivers that show all the short cuts to a location. Even if they have to drive through residential areas. The app will calculate the shortest distance and time depending on traffic.

My idea is to have a service like zipcar in which someone rents the use of a car by paying a monthly fee except that it would be mopeds for individuals or something larger like a pick up truck.  Just more options than a small smart car.  I used to live in Tokyo and driving a car there was awful but not something like a moped or motorcycle because they could ride in between the cars.  A larger vehicle like a pickup truck would be good for people who need to rent something to haul furniture or something like that but don't want to drive all the way to a car rental place or Lowe's to get the truck.  Everything would be rentable using an app and the cars would feature opening the doors and starting the cars through the app itself.

My idea would be to use a moving belt (like used in airport terminals) instead of sidewalks to get around my neighborhood. I live is a small town (population about 500), so it would encourage people to drive less to get to destinations that are close to their homes.

The transportation system would be a combination of roads with cars and a railroad track. All of the cars would be connected and be able to drive themselves. The transportation would be efficient; it would be green and rely on newer energies that are not dependent upon fossil fuels. It also would be future-proof, such that it would reduce and combat the issues of traffic jams and collisions. We still would have private and public transportation, allowing people to make the choice of which is better for their needs. There also would be strict requirements for those who choose to drive; thus reducing the amount of likely collisions. It would be affordable and allow society to continue to grow and prosper.

There could be a really good motorcycle driver that would drive fast and come pick you up. He would know back roads and side allys very well. He could weve in and out of traffic and get you somewhere really fast.

think it will be self driving cars aka taxis coming soon. really when apple says they are working on a self driving car

This idea would have to be built in a city near a river, or attached to a solar farm because it relies on using naturally produced hydroelectric or solar power. Combining food delivery services with taxi driving to maximize efficiency.

I think it would be great to have a jitney-type bus that you could hail like a cab directly from the street.  The jitney would be electric powered and follow a specific route.  I think this would be great because I live in a town that has many tourists, but does not have a large population.  It could shuttle tourists to different areas, but the tourists wouldn't have to worry about a specific bus schedule.  The jitney could drive on streets that are not bus-accessible (some of our streets are "old world" and very narrow). There is also some frustration in my town about not having a vibrant night life because of lack of public transportation.  This jitney would allow people to go downtown, especially college students, and have some drinks without worrying about driving.  One of the stops would be the college campus. The jitney would have a very low fair to encourage people not to drink and drive.  This jitney would help downtown businesses and restaurants.

I'm imagining a car sharing service with locations throughout the city where you can go pick up a car without having to reserve one in advance. Nor would you have to interact with any people at the pickup/dropoff location. It would be somehow automated. Perhaps you would subscribe to the service an at annual or monthly rate and be given a special kind of 'key' that would give access to any of the cars currently at the pick up location. It would be first come first serve, and there would be smart technology embedded in both the cars and the keys. Your universal key would be linked to your account, and the car you used would transmit all relevant information to the system. Such as , time of pick up. number of miles drive. amount of gas used. Then the fees would be adjusted accordingly based on the type of car you used, miles driven, gas consumed etc. all of this without any human employees and all the fuss that comes with tradiional car rental. Things like insurance and billing info would all be done upfront when a patron sets up an account. This is genius, the more i think about it!

My small rural town doesn't even have an intact bus system, so anything would be better than it is now. But I would like a service that has people who drive pick up trucks to help you move things. A Bus system, within the metro area that was funded by a tax on gas purchased by individual commuters. Also, have all busses make a stop in the center of town so if you need to get across town, take a bus from you house to the center, and from there to your final destination. There should be a bus passing every school, hospital, shopping center, library ect. No need to waste resources and infrastructure on schedules, call centers, web pages, just keep it simple and convenient.

A central hub for a ridesharing service that provides cars for small groups to take to neighboring towns. I live in a rural area, a few minutes from a very small village. A ridesharing service would make accessing these places much easier, and if the company provided the car (for a fee, of course), those without vehicles could be serviced.

A going to town app. In a rural area like where I live sometimes you avoid going to town because you don't have a ride or you just don't feel you can justify driving all that way just to run a quick errand. Enter an app that connects you to people along your travel rout who also need to go into town. You could flag yourself as offering a ride or needing a ride.

A group carpooling smartphone app that allows people in apartment complexes or housing areas to visualize a profile of others in the area that are traveling to a nearby destination. Participants can communicate over the app, and background check and everything is done before being certified to use the service. People can post looking for ride notes, or say that they are traveling to a specific area and looking for passengers to ride in order to split costs.
A high speed train/subway that links all the cities in the Detroit metro area.
A large network of rails traveling from downtown to every other part part of the surrounding area featuring energy efficient, sleek that arrive every ten to twenty minutes at each station
a large open vehicle that moves slowly on wheels around the downtown area, carries about 25 people

A more thorough bus system with buses running more frequently and covering a wider area.  Other modes would not be feasible for this area.



An Uber-type crowd-sourced system for carpooling.

A motorized scooter "stop."  Basically a few very popular areas you can pick up a scooter from an agent.  Credit is the only thing that's acceptable, as they need to have something on file in case you ride off with the scooter.  These locations where you can both rent, and return scooters will only be in very popular areas (Such as the mall, a large amount of business buildings, and the like.)  Make it relatively affordable, and have people be able to write it off as an expense.

A moving sidewalk - like the ones you would see in an airport to help expedite movement between terminals.  Around my area there are a lot of close shops, so people could walk, but getting loads of bags home would be difficult.  Having mechanical walkways would enable people to do their shopping but reduce their need to use cars, and at the same time set all their bags down so they don't have to figure out how to lug them home, especially if they've purchased something heavy.  It could also allow people to get where they need to go faster, if they continue to walk along the moving sidewalk.  They could sit alongside regular sidewalks, so people who still wanted to go out for a walk and get some fresh air could do so.  The mechanical/moving sidewalks would be made out of metal, look like a flat escalator, have hand railings, and each side of the road would have a sidewalk that goes the same way as traffic.
A moving sidewalk could be useful in some areas of my neighbourhood.
A new railway system! We don't have any trains or railways anywhere near the area I live in.

A new transportation system in my neighborhood would be a railway system available to rural and outlying areas.  It would stretch along the roadway and connect to different cities and stops much like a trolley system or train system.  People could get on and off at different points.  They could schedule to be picked up at different times during the day.

There would be different areas for kids, a lounge area, an elevator that would take you do the different levels. You would pay a monthly fee and it would have a path where it would make stops. Not just a mode of transporation, but a fun transportation where you can relax and interact with people at the same time.
A online map real time of the buses and trains the area. Buses and trains aren't usually on time and having real on time traffic will show if its a bad bad to drive.

A roaming private car that you can pay by the mile or carpool. Basically, the car would go up and down the street or area and put trips together (like going to the grocery store or the same shopping center) and split the costs, so it can be as affordable as a bus but more private.

A service where you can easily pick up a ride to ublic transportation. many people live in areas where public transportation is just slighlty out of reach. this would allow people to get there in an easy an inexpensive manner.

A smartphone app similar to uber but for carpooling. Once it hits a predetermined amount of users needing a ride in a concentrated area, the app suggests grouping the users together and designates possible drivers to pick them up if users agree.

A solar-powered trolley system that works like an automated bus, mixed with a roller coaster. a system of bikes that one can rent for free. Bike racks are located every few miles. People can use a key to scan and take out a bike, and return it at any of the racks in the area.

A system of neighborhood drivers who form a cooperative and use their own vehicles to provide transportation services. We live in a community of 1875 people in a rural area, it may not be practical, but it is doable.
A system with bike racks so people can rent bikes and ride around would be nice. There can be multiple areas to be rented from.

A transportation Idea I have is to have networked building walkways. Think of it like your average street crossing but instead of connecting streets it connects neighboring buildings instead. There would be no access to private buildings but pedestrians would be able to walk enclosed walkways running through special areas in the building to get to the next. I think this idea is very practical in heavy urban areas and would be a refreshing change from the average commute.

A trolley system would be a great source of transportation, using small trolleys instead of buses.  Another Idea would be a mini bus system that primarily transported people to key areas like the train station or the airport.  A shuttle system.

A vehicle which does not have contact with the earth. That means the vehicle repels with the earth, that is a force against the gravity. Along any road, there can be a big truck that bicyclists, skateboarders, roller bladers, etc can hold on to to they can get a break and a boost in speed. An above-ground train system. We scrapped a trolley system, and some areas can't support a subway. Above-ground might be useful for us.

Automated taxi service. Would have several dispatch stations in key areas of city. Person could call for a ride from an app on their phone and it would send a car to them. The software could calculate rate for the trip and make you pay before as a confirmation before sending a car out. Car could then drive customer to said destination.  Self driveable cars that could provide a much better service than the often RUDE cab drivers could provide. Plus, I trust a robot way more than some of these morons driving!

Companies should use some of their advertising budget to provide rides to certain places. Drones.  They are on the cutting edge of technology.  Amazon is going to implement them. Electric bicycles that work only within a specified area. Like shopping carts that lock wheels when taken too far away from the store, these bikes would lock up when taken outside the area. Anyone can use these bikes within this area.

Fully automated system of public transit; similar in function to a subway but smaller and without drivers (more like the automated tram systems used at airports). Vehicle would be the size of a small city bus but could connect to some city-run data network to find and avoid traffic stops and slowdowns (and use/switch between already existing bus lanes and subway tracks?). It would be more reliable than a bus system, which is rarely on time where I live, but more accessible than a subway/railway, which does not reach enough areas of my city for me to use frequently.

Get some large vans and people who are going to the same general area to work can all ride together.  They take turns driving.  It'll be like kids' school buses but for adults.
